Ryder tells the July issue of Empire&#xA0;magazine. &quot;At one point they asked if I wanted to play Lisa and I said, &apos;No, I want to be Susanna.&apos;&quot;  &quot;But there was no resentment,&quot; Ryder went on. &quot;When it came out, people almost felt bad for me. But I expected it all along. I was really happy with the film, and really proud of it.&quot;\r\n\r\nIf anything, Ryder said she felt bad for Jolie.   &quot;At the time I worked with her, she was battling her looks because she&apos;s so beautiful,&quot; she said. &quot;She wanted very much to be taken seriously and not just judged on her looks. And she conquered that.&quot;\r\n\r\nRyder also confirmed a sequel is in the works to her 1988 cult film Heathers.\r\n\r\n&quot;Whatever you hear, there is a sequel in the works. I swear to God,&quot; she told the magazine. &quot;But for some reason the writer Dan Waters and director Michael Lehman don&apos;t want to talk about it. On Sunday, when stars gathered to tape the pre-recorded awards ceremony that aired one day later, the comedian called out the former High School Musical star&apos;s name.\r\nSee more photos of topless stars.\r\n&quot;Girl, you gots to keep your clothes! Phones are for phone calls, girl,&quot; he said, referencing her most recent topless pictures to be leaked online. (Photos of her posing nude in lingerie also surfaced in late 2007, forcing Hudgens to apologize and say she was &quot;embarrassed over the situation.&quot;)  The camera -- which panned on her smiling face when he first mentioned the 20-year-old star -- zoomed in on her less-than-pleased reaction.\r\nSee photos of Vanessa in High School Musical.\r\nFox, the network that aired the Teen Choice Awards, cut the clip from Monday&apos;s show.  A show rep tells Us: &quot;The taping of TEEN CHOICE 2009 must be edited down to time for the two-hour broadcast on FOX.  Therefore, various show elements that were part of the taping will not appear in the broadcast version of the show.&quot;  After the show on Sunday, Cook told Access Hollywood that the joke was a late addition to his bit.  &quot;That&apos;s the best part about being a comic when you go, &apos;Maybe I can say the thing that everybody is kind of feeling and nobody [is saying].&apos; The elephant in the room moment. So, I&apos;ll take it, I&apos;ll take the hit. Pitt will play Billy Beane, the A&apos;s general manager who assembled the team on shoestring budget with new technology to draft players.   Tryouts are currently being held for baseball players, and the movie -- scheduled for a 2011 release -- will begin filming next week in Anaheim, California.\r\nSee photos of Brad Pitt through the years.\r\n&quot;I want it to be really funny and entertaining, and I want you to not realize how much information is being thrown at you because you&apos;re having fun,&quot; the film&apos;s director, Steven Soderbergh, has said. completing shooting on Salt in NYC.\r\nSee photos of Brad and Angelina in Cannes.\r\n&quot;Angie&apos;s been working, and I&apos;ve got to be home a lot with the kids,&quot; he said. &quot;Let me be Escapism is survival to me.&quot;\r\nSee what Johnny Depp and other stars look like as cartoons\r\nLittle Hall&apos;s Pond Cay features six different beaches, named after Depp&apos;s partner, Vanessa Paradis, and their children, Lily Rose, 10, and Jack, 7, as well as his mentors Hunter S. Thompson and Marlon Brando.  He also deemed one patch of water &quot;Heath&apos;s Place&quot; after the late actor Heath Ledger. (Depp plays an incarnation of Ledger in the fantasy movie, The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus, due later this year.)\r\nLook back at Heath Ledger&apos;s life\r\nThe island features several small residences, all solar-powered, and transportation consists of a fleet of green golf carts. &quot;I don&apos;t think I&apos;d ever seen any place so pure and beautiful,&quot; says Depp, who headlines the July thriller Public Enemies. &quot;You can feel your pulse rate drop about 20 beats. It&apos;s instant freedom. And that rare beast-simplicity-can be had. And a little morsel of anonymity. Whenever I was getting frustrated about being &apos;novelty boy&apos; and making movies, I told myself, &apos;Calm down. I can come down here and disappear.&apos; I spent the Christmas season here with Vanessa and the kids. You can feed hot dogs to the nurse sharks in the Exumas-but it&apos;s best to not swim when doing it.&quot;\r\nSee what your favorite stars looked like before they were famous\r\nHe says he looks forward to his kids growing up on the island, &quot;spending months out of the year here ... learning about sea life and how to protect sea life ... and their kids growing up here, and so on. Theoretically, this place can add years to your life.&quot;\r\nCheck out Johnny Depp and Hollywood&apos;s sexiest dads\r\nThen, quoting an old adage, Depp says: &quot;Money doesn&apos;t buy you happiness. Sources add that Candy&apos;s camp even called in advance and asked if camera crews for Tori&apos;s Oxygen show would be present. Tori assured them she would be respectful of her mother&apos;s wishes if she didn&apos;t want to be filmed.   &quot;She still chose not to come,&quot; says a source.\r\nTake a peek at Tori and husband Dean McDermott&apos;s family photo album \r\nA Candy source tells Us, &quot;Candy did RSVP to the event but decided not to attend when she found out there would be cameras there. She wanted it to be an entirely private meeting.&quot;  But a Tori source says Candy &quot;knew there would be cameras and had her people call a week before to have the photo releases sent over.&quot;\r\nSee then-and-now photos of your favorite 90210 stars\r\n&quot;She waited until one hour before the event to notify Tori, by email, that she wasn&apos;t attending,&quot; adds the source. &quot;Tori was busy preparing and didn&apos;t get the email until after the party. She was waiting for her mom the whole time.&quot;\r\nAs for Candy&apos;s concerns for privacy, the Tori insider tells Us, &quot;It was a big party and there was plenty of opportunity for a private meeting.&quot;\r\nSee Tori Spelling and other moms in bikinis\r\nTori and Candy have been estranged for some time.   Their feud took a new twist late last month when Candy remarked that Tori had abandoned her father before his 2006 death and &quot;that&apos;s what killed my husband.&quot;  Tori has never revealed the reason she doesn&apos;t talk to her mother. (She has vaguely said they just &quot;don&apos;t go together.&quot;)\r\nSee Tori Spelling and other stars at fashion week!\r\nIn April, Candy -- who released her frank memoir Stories From Candyland a few weeks before Tori debuted her book, Mommyhood -- posted a public letter to Tori on her website, pushing for a reconciliation.\r\nBut Tori told Usmagazine.com in April, &quot;If I said one thing to my mother, it wouldn&apos;t be public because if she does intend to have a relationship with her grandchildren -- which I am totally open to -- I just would like her to approach us privately.&quot;", the actress has decided to discuss her recent recasting publicly.  \n\nOn Wednesday, Lefevre -- who played villain Victoria -- said she was &quot;stunned&quot; the studio had replaced her with Bryce Dallas Howard in the film&apos;s upcoming third installment, Eclipse, because of a scheduling conflict. She said she had signed on to the shoot the indie Barney&apos;s Version, which begins filming the same day as Eclipse, but stressed that her commitment to the film was only two weeks. Said Lefevre, &quot;Never did I fathom I would lose the role over a 10-day overlap.&quot;  \nCheck out the latest Robert Pattinson news\nBut Summit painted a different picture in the statement late Wednesday:\n&quot;We at Summit Entertainment are disappointed by Rachelle Lefevre&apos;s recent comments, which attempt to make her career choices the fault of the studio. Her decision to discuss her version of the scheduling challenges publicly has forced the studio to set the record straight and correct the facts.\n&quot;Ms. Lefevre&apos;s representatives were advised as early as April that The Twilight Saga: Eclipse was expected to start shooting in early August.\n&quot;If Ms. Lefevre was, as she describes, &apos;passionate&apos; about being part of the Twilight saga, we feel that she and her representatives would have included us in her decision to work on another film that would conflict with the shooting schedule of The Twilight Saga: Eclipse.\n\n&quot;It was not until July 20th that Summit was first informed of Ms. Lefevre&apos;s commitment to Barney&apos;s Version, a commitment we have since been advised she accepted in early June. Summit had acted in good faith that she would be available to fulfill her obligations both in terms of rehearsals and shooting availability for The Twilight Saga: Eclipse. We feel that her choice to withhold her scheduling conflict information from us can be viewed as a lack of cooperative spirit which affected the entire production.\n&quot;Furthermore, Ms. Lefevre took a role in the other film that places her in Europe during the required rehearsal time, and at least 10 days of [Eclipse]&apos;s principal photography. This period is essential for both rehearsal time with the cast and for filming at key locations that are only available during the initial part of production.  \nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos\n&quot;Contrary to Ms. Lefevre&apos;s statement, it is simply untrue that the studio dismissed her over a 10-day overlap,&quot; the statement concludes. &quot;It is not about a 10-day overlap, but instead about the fact that The Twilight Saga: Eclipse is an ensemble production that has to accommodate the schedules of numerous actors while respecting the established creative vision of the Mo was treated for dehydration.\r\n\r\n&quot;It certainly was scary to me this season, but we have a lot of medical staff backing us up and making sure they are OK,&quot; Sweeney says. &quot;If anything, it&apos;s a lesson. Get out there and walk and move your body.&quot;\r\nWhen asked if the show is safe, Sweeney insists, &quot;Absolutely!&quot;&#xA0;\r\n\r\nShe says the players underestimate how tough it will be to compete on the NBC show.\r\n&quot;The Biggest Losers contestants always come and say, &apos;I didn&apos;t realize it was going to be this hard. You know, I mean, that&apos;s hardly a makeover.&quot;  \nSee Us&apos; makeovers the year!\nThe 47-year-old debuted a $50 darker dye job last month &quot;just to tidy myself up, like any other female would have done,&quot; she says.   Boyle isn&apos;t sure she&apos;ll win Britain&apos;s Got Talent -- despite having over 100 million YouTube views of her first performance.  &quot;Well, I hope I have the chance, but at the same time, there&apos;s a lot of other talent in the competition, so I&apos;m willing to take my place with them,&quot; she says. &quot;There&apos;s a lot of good talent on the show.&quot;  \nSee the most controversial reality stars of all time.\nBoyle tells Winfrey she began singing at school to help her handle a learning disability.  &quot;I was kind of a slow learner at school, so getting something like singing was a good way of hiding behind that and so boosting my confidence,&quot; she says. &quot;I sang at karaokes, which most people do for fun. And I did sing at one or two occasions within the family.&quot;  But when her mother -- her No. 1 supporter -- died in 2007, she stopping singing.  &quot;After that, there was a wee period where I didn&apos;t sing,&quot; she says.   She tried out for Talent to come to terms with the loss.  &quot;You try and keep going through that pain, and that&apos;s what I tried to do with my singing. I am very slowly getting over it,&quot; she says. &quot;One of the reasons I applied for the TV show was to try to see if I could perform in front of an audience.&quot;\nCheck out the day&apos;s top news photos.\nNow she has photographers camped outside her home and even gets fan mail for her cat, Pebbles.  &quot;It all takes a bit of time to take in. I mean, these things have happened so quickly. It&apos;s pretty awesome,&quot; she says.  &quot;I think change is always very hard to come by at first, but I&apos;m really enjoying it and really enjoying every second of it,&quot; she continues. &quot;It&apos;s like a dream come true.&quot;  Simon Cowell says watching Boyle perform was &quot;one of [his] favorite moments&quot; on the show.   But now she&apos;s under &quot;tremendous pressure, tremendous scrutiny,&quot; Cowell goes on. When asked if he thinks she can win, he says, &quot;I do.  &quot;You&apos;ve got practically the whole world behind you now,&quot; Cowell told Boyle. &quot;So I want to say congratulations and wish I definitely believe that if you stop working at relationships, they go away.&quot;\nThe 31-year-old star wasn&apos;t always so lucky.   Before he rose to fame, he recalls early years when he was broke.  \nSee photos of more stars -- including Demi Moore&apos;s ex! -- before they were famous.\n&quot;I bought my whole family these fake watches and fake Versace pants and fake anything I could find, like fake Calvin Klein T-shirts, so I could take them home and show them how well I was doing even though I didn&apos;t have a place to live.&quot;\nPrior to meeting Moore, he even traded up for a good night&apos;s sleep.\n&quot;It was always a good thing when you hooked up with a girl and got to sleep someplace nice for the night,&quot; he says. &quot;I wasn&apos;t there to stay, but if you did hit it off with a girl, her place was always nicer than yours.&quot;\nSee photos of other romantic star couples.\nStill, Kutcher admits there&apos;s a downside to living the Hollywood life.\n&quot;Of course there is a price,&quot; he says. &quot;I&apos;ve only been back home to Iowa once in the last year and a half to see my family. I go and shoot a film and spend months away from my wife and my girls [Rumer, 20, Scout, 17, and Tallulah, 15]. And that&apos;s a price to pay. I also don&apos;t get to see my friends very often. You can&apos;t complain when you&apos;re so blessed. I get so many things that the notion of me complaining is obscene. It&apos;s absurd. It&apos;s ridiculous.&quot;\nThe former That &apos;70s Show actor and Punk&apos;d host stresses that he&apos;s the same goofball he&apos;s always been.\n&quot;I&apos;m still looking for trouble. I&apos;m still disruptive,&quot; he tells Parade. &quot;I&apos;m still doing some things that other people don&apos;t like.&quot;\nHe adds, beaming: &quot;I hear, &apos;You&apos;re a moron,&apos; of Way She Handled Kanye Incident", "datePublished": "2009-09-15T14:42:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-10-15T17:07:51-04:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "He tells Us it was \"all Beyonce's decision\" to invite Taylor Swift on stage at the VMAs", "articleBody": "&#xA0;\r\nBeyonce&apos;s father Mathew Knowles is proud of how his daughter, 28, consoled Taylor Swift at Sunday&apos;s MTV Video Music Awards.\r\nAfter winning video of the year, Beyonce invited Swift on stage to finish her Best Female Video acceptance speech, which Kanye West famously interrupted earlier in the night because he felt Beyonce deserved to win.\r\n&quot;It wasn&apos;t my decision to bring Taylor out,&quot; Mathew Knowles, who also serves as Beyonce&apos;s manager, tells Usmagazine.com. &quot;It was all Beyonce&apos;s decision. I want to be clear about that. My job is to execute and come up with some ideas, but ultimately that was Beyonce&apos;s decision.&quot;\r\n\r\n&quot;I can only say it was a proud night for me as a manager, but more importantly as a father,&quot; he adds, noting that daughter Solange performed on the show as well.\r\n\r\nSee what all the stars wore to the VMAs\r\n&quot;I&apos;ve always said the thing that makes me most proud about Beyonce is not how many records she sold or how many plaques she has or how many awards; it&apos;s that she&apos;s a genuine good person,&quot; he tells Us. &quot;I know it&apos;s hard for people to believe that she can really be that nice of a person, but she really is.&quot;\r\n\r\n\r\nAs for West, 32, he told Jay Leno Monday night that he&apos;s taking &quot;some time off&quot; to (A spokesman for ABC denies knowledge of the course.)\r\nThe title is real, though it doesn&apos;t translate into a castle and throne (titles haven&apos;t even been recognized in Italy since 1947).\r\nThe Borghese family is said to be deeply embarrassed by Lorenzo&apos;s participation in the show, though his recent foray into the Borghese Cosmetics line hardly bolstered his pedigree.\r\nLorenzo&apos;s contribution to the family business?  A line of doggie grooming products called Royal Treatment Pet Care, including the Stinky-B-Gone odor fighting kit, the Pumpkin Patch spritz, and the After Bath Pet Robe. Dimond told Us in an interview on June 26. &quot;This is not a man who suffers pain well. He likes painkillers. So he got some from here, he got some from there -- who knows how much.&quot;\r\nSee shocking photos of Michael Jackson&apos;s changing face over the years.\r\nUp until his death, Jackson was focused on his tour, for which he was paid a reported $70 million advance.\r\nBut those close to the singer worry the 50-year-old King of Pop might have taken on too much too soon.\r\nJackson suffered persistent insomnia in recent months, sources tell Us.\r\n&quot;For the past 15 years, Michael always slept until 3 or 4 in the afternoon and was up all night,&quot; a source tells Us Weekly. &quot;When he started rehearsals for the tour, it totally screwed up his system.&quot;\r\nRevisit the King of Pop&apos;s most memorable moments.\r\nJackson, the source adds, began adding stimulants to his daily drug regimen in order to rise earlier. Cherilyn Lee, a registered nurse whose specialty includes nutritional counseling, told the Associated Press Tuesday that she repeatedly rejected his demands for the drug, Diprivan, which is given intravenously and induces sleep.\r\nShe said she received a strange phone call from a Jackson staff member four days before the singer&apos;s death that made her fear that he somehow obtained Diprivan or another drug.\r\n&quot;He called and was very frantic and said, &apos;Michael needs to see you right away.&apos; I said, &apos;What&apos;s wrong?&apos; And I could hear Michael in the background..., &apos;One side of my body is hot, it&apos;s hot, and one side of my body is cold. It&apos;s very cold,&apos;&quot; Lee said.\r\nSee photos of the singer through the years.\r\n&quot;I said, &apos;Tell him he needs to go the hospital. I don&apos;t know what&apos;s going on, but he needs to go to the hospital ... right away.&quot;\r\n&quot;At that point, I knew that somebody had given him something that hit the central nervous system,&quot; she said, adding, &quot;He was in trouble Sunday and he was crying out.&quot;\r\nJackson did not go to the hospital.\r\nHe died after suffering cardiac arrest.\r\nThough an official cause of death is not expected for several weeks, Lee told the AP: &quot;I don&apos;t know what happened there. The only thing I can say is he was adamant about this drug.&quot;\r\nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids.\r\nCalifornia officials announced Wednesday the federal Drug Enforcement Agency is said attorney Edward Chernoff. &quot;Mr. Jackson was still warm and had a pulse.&quot;\r\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\r\nThe doctor then immediately began administering CPR, Chernoff said. He later accompanied the singer in an ambulance to the UCLA Medical Center, where the King of Pop was pronounced dead at 2:26 p.m. PST Thursday.  Denying various media reports, Chernoff also said Dr. Conrad never prescribed or gave Jackson the drugs Demerol or OxyContin that may have contributed to the singer&apos;s death.\r\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\r\nAny drugs the doctor gave Jackson were prescribed in response to a specific complaint from singer, Chernoff said.  &quot;Dr. Murray has never prescribed nor administered Demerol to Michael Jackson,&quot; Chernoff told the AP. &quot;Not ever. Not that day. ... Not Oxycontin (either), for that matter.&quot;  Chernoff tells the Los Angeles Times the doctor was stunned by Jackson&apos;s passing.  &quot;He was the one who suggested the autopsy to the family while they were still in the hospital. He didn&apos;t understand why Michael Jackson had died,&#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x9D; he said.\r\nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\r\nDr. Murray met with Los Angeles detectives Saturday. control", "articleBody": "Tuesday&apos;s memorial service for Michael Jackson cost the financially-strapped city of Los Angeles $1.4 million.\nThe amount included $1.1 million in overtime pay for the 4,173 police officers who worked to secure Staples Center, Forest Lawn cemetery and other areas that attracted more than 17,000 fans and members of the media, the Police Department said in a statement.\nSee photos from Michael Jackson&apos;s memorial\nThe remaining amount was spent on traffic control, cleanup and other memorial service costs.  \nLook back at photos of Michael Jackson and his children through the years\nDespite the high cost, Matt Szabo -- a spokesman for Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa -- told the Associated Press the amount was &quot;far less&quot; than the initial estimate of $4 million.\nStill, city attorney Carmen Trutanich said his office was investigating how the city can legally press third parties to pick up at least some of the tab. A report will be delivered to City Council by Friday. City Council will then create a policy declaring who should pay for city services associated with such events.\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s appearance has changed over the years\nLos Angeles is $530 million in debt.\nA PayPal donation site has been set up for public donations. wrote Randee Dawn of The Hollywood Reporter. &quot;O&apos;Brien commanded the stage, but seemed more comfortable laughing it up with erstwhile sidekick-turned-announcer Andy Richter than in interacting with his 380 audience members.&quot;\nSee then-and-now photos of your favorite TV stars\nO&apos;Brien&apos;s opening monologue mostly consisted of &quot;sketch upon sketch&quot; -- notes New York Post TV critic Linda Stasi -- most of which were &quot;at times, painfully unfunny.&quot;  In one scene, O&apos;Brien -- who spent the last 17 years as host of NBC&apos;s Late Night -- was shown jogging across the country from New York to Los Angeles. &quot;I think I&apos;ve timed this move perfectly,&quot; he quipped. &quot;I&apos;m on a last-place network, I moved to a state that&apos;s bankrupt and The Tonight Show is sponsored by General Motors.&quot;  Other clips showed him giving a tram tour of Universal Studios, sitting in the last row of a Lakers game (to show how well he&apos;s acclimated to L.A.)  and paying homage to his beat-up 1992 Ford Taurus.  &quot;Again,&quot; said Stasi, &quot;not a million big laughs.&quot;\nSee what this famous TV kid star looks like all grown up\n David Hinckley of New York&apos;s Daily News said the bits &quot;lasted too long.&quot; Said Hinckley, &quot;He&apos;s from the world of sketch comedy, not monologues, and he sticks with an idea as long as he feels something funny could happen.&quot;  Ken Tucker of Entertainment Weekly got a chuckle out of the sketches.  &quot;All in all, a large-scale, impressive debut,&quot; he wrote. &quot;But we all know that success in late-night depends on the long haul -- Conan knows this as well as anyone. So now I want to see how he follows up his glitzy debut.&quot;\nSee famous TV scandals\nAdded USA Today&apos;s Robert Bianco: &quot;Overall, the show wasn&apos;t O&apos;Brien at his funniest, but it was funny enough to get by.&quot;  Check out today&apos;s top celeb news photos David Letterman definitely took notice of his new competition.  &quot;I&apos;m still here,&quot; Mr. Letterman told his audience on his show Monday night. &quot;I knocked off another competitor.&quot;  He said that his mother had called him to say, &quot;Well, David, I see you didn&apos;t get the Tonight Show again.&apos;&quot; When he said he told his mom that he had Bill Cosby as his guest, his mother replied: &quot;&apos;OK, maybe I&apos;ll switch from Conan.&apos;&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": taken in a suite at the Four Seasons Hotel in Beverly Hills about two weeks after Paris&apos; April 1998 birth &#x2013; show Jackson hugging Prince as Rowe holds Paris for the first time.\n&quot;At one point she was gently rocking Paris in her arms and humming a lullaby to her. It was a very special mother-and-baby moment,&quot; the photographer told the paper. &quot;Paris was asleep in her mother&apos;s arms and looked very contented.&quot;  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\nAdded the photographer, &quot;It was obvious that Debbie loved her children and there was a strong connection between them. It looked like she was treasuring every second, laughing, kissing and playing with them for about two hours.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\n&quot;Michael didn&apos;t spend much time talking to Debbie during the meeting - but he was happy to watch her with the children,&quot; the shutterbug said. &quot;It was his idea to do the photos. He was already thinking ahead. He wanted the pictures so he could show the children when they were older, so they&apos;d know who their mother is.&quot;  Despite reports that Rowe plans to fight for custody of Prince, 12, and Paris, 11, she &quot;has not reached a final decision concerning the custody proceedings,&quot; her attorney Eric George told Usmagazine.com last week.\nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids through the years\nRowe &#x2013; who was spotted over the weekend at her Palmdale, Calif., horse farm &#x2013; has not spoken publicly about the custody proceedings, but told NBCLA&apos;s Chuck Henry in a phone conversation (that was not broadcast) last week that she wants the kids. &quot;I have no reason to doubt that what was reported from that conversation was accurately and ethically reported, but that said, it would be a distortion of the truth to allow that single snapshot of a single conversation, to stand as the truth on Debbie&apos;s position on this sensitive matter,&quot; her attorney told Us.\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nA guardianship hearing scheduled for Monday has been postponed until July 13 at the request of attorneys for Rowe and Katherine Jackson.  Rowe wed Jackson in 1996 (he was a patient in the dermatologist&apos;s office, where she worked as a nurse). The children were born through artificial insemination. (The new issue of Us Weekly exclusively reports that children&apos;s father is Arnold Klein, Jackson&apos;s L.A.-based dermatologist and Rowe&apos;s former boss.)  After Jackson and Rowe divorced in 1999, she agreed to give up her parental rights, insisting Jackson was a good father. Abdul&apos;s manager, David Sonenberg, who has yet to receive a proposal for her return, told The Los Angeles Times. She&apos;s hurt. She&apos;s angry,&quot; Sonenberg said. &quot;I think at this point we&apos;re going to be considering everything, including some kind of a competition show. She has tremendous ideas for a whole variety of shows.&quot;  During an appearance on The Late Show With David Letterman last month, the Idol vet -- who has judged wannabe superstars since the show&apos;s inception in 2002 -- was cryptic about a return.\r\nSee Paula&apos;s wackiest outfits of all time.\r\n&quot;I never said [I wasn&apos;t returning]. Judge Randy Jackson is signed onto the series through 2011, while Kara DioGuardi has also expressed interest in returning.   Simon Cowell&apos;s future remains up in the air, however. The star announced her engagement on ABC&apos;s Good Morning America Tuesday.  &quot;Sometimes the stars align and the clouds part and everything works out the way it should,&quot; she said.   Rycroft also updated her Twitter page with the news: &quot;Guess the secret&apos;s out...Thank you all so much for being so great and supportive!! We&apos;re soooo excited!&quot;  The newly engaged couple first celebrated with their parents over dinner at Brio.  &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x153;He had the proposal all planned out in advance and completely surprised her,&quot; a source tells Usmagazine.com. &quot;The dinner was a surprise as well. She&apos;s so proud of him for being able to pull it off without anyone finding out!&#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x9D;  They then continued the party with 20 friends at Cretia&apos;s restaurant that night, a staffer from the eatery tells Us.  &quot;When they walked in, everybody stood up and clapped,&quot; the staffer says, adding that Rycroft looked &quot;beaming happy.&quot;  According to the staffer, the 26-year-old Texas native and Strickland toasted with champagne and stayed until the restaurant closed at 2 a.m.  \n&#xA0;\nSee what Melissa Rycroft and all the stars wore to the 2009 Us Weekly Hollywood party.\nRycroft and her insurance agent beau began quietly dating shortly after she was proposed to and then unceremoniously dumped six weeks later by Jason Mesnick in March.  &quot;We&apos;ve been really good friends, but the timing was never right,&quot; she told Us at the time. &quot;With all this going on, he&apos;s my support system. It&apos;s funny how things happen.&quot;   Check out DWTS members&apos; amazing makeovers. Rycroft explained why they waited to announce their engagement.  &quot;Sorry we kept it a secret for a few days,&quot; she wrote on her Facebook page. &quot;We kind of thought there were more important things going on throughout the weekend, and it would be rude to make our announcement during all that.&quot;  No wedding date has been set.   &quot;They just want to enjoy their engagement for awhile,&quot; the source tells Us. &quot;She couldn&apos;t be more thrilled.&quot;  The engagement comes a week after Rycroft started her new job on ABC&apos;s Good Morning America. The actor spent $956,000 on a Neo Rauch oil painting, entitled Etappe, according to Bloomberg. The 9-foot-wide painting, done in 1998, shows a swirling view of a driver behind a red racecar, with workers nearby carrying hoses.\r\nCheck out Brad Pitt&apos;s high school yearbook photo\r\nAccording to the Wall Street Journal, Pitt eyed the painting for several minutes while rubbing his goatee and fidgeting with his tweed hat. He initially walked away. &quot;He&apos;s on the fence. Nothing wrong with that, I guess,&quot; New York dealer David Zwirner said.\r\nLook back at Brad and Angelina&apos;s most romantic moments\r\nBut within minutes, Pitt returned with Los Angeles I&apos;ve never taken the time off to really -- you know, just music after music and tour after tour.\r\n\r\n&quot;I&apos;m just ashamed that my hurt caused someone else&apos;s hurt -- and I don&apos;t try to justify it because I was just in the wrong. That&apos;s period,&quot; he went on. &quot;But I need to, after this, take some time off and just analyze how I&apos;m going to make it through the rest of this life, how I&apos;m going to improve. Because I am a celebrity, and that&apos;s something I have to deal with.&#xA0;\r\n&quot;And if there&apos;s anything I could do to help Taylor in the future or help anyone, I&apos;d like -- you know, I want to live this thing. It&apos;s hard sometimes,&quot; he said.\r\nWhen Leno asked West if his mom, Donda, who died from plastic surgery complications, would have been disappointed in his behavior, he admitted, &quot;Yeah.&quot;\r\n\r\nWest -- who appeared on the show to perform &quot;Run This Town&quot; with Jay-Z and Rihanna -- said it&apos;s been an &quot;extremely difficult&quot; day.\r\n&quot;Just dealing with the fact that I hurt someone or took anything away, you know, from a talented artist or from anyone, because I only wanted to help people,&quot; he said. &quot;My entire life, I&apos;ve only wanted to give and do something that I felt was right. And I immediately knew in the situation that it was wrong, and it wasn&apos;t a spectacle or just -- you know, it&apos;s actually someone&apos;s emotions, you know, that I stepped on. And it was very -- it was just -- it was rude, period.\r\n&quot;And, you know, I&apos;d like to be able to apologize to her in person. The 17-year-old gymnast won Dancing With the Stars Tuesday night. She and professional dance partner Mark Ballas beat out fellow finalists Gilles Marini and Melissa Rycroft on the ABC show&apos;s season finale.\r\nSee photos of Shawn Johnson and the other finalists throughout the season!\r\n&quot;I&apos;ve learned I can be more than just a gymnast!&quot; Johnson, the third Olympian in eight seasons to win the mirrorball prize, told Usmagazine.com. &quot;I&apos;ve really grown as a person. This has really changed my life. This whole thing has been the time of my life -- just an amazing experience.&quot;  All three finalists performed one last dance, each earning a perfect score of 30 from the judges. After viewer votes were combined with the judges&apos; scores, Rycroft was dismissed first.\r\nSee photos of the outrageous costumes from DWTS of seasons past.\r\nShow host Tom Bergeron said &quot;less than one percent&quot; separated Johnson and runner-up Marini, who was paired with pro dancer Cheryl Burke.  Johnson and Ballas were completely shocked when they were announced as winners.   &quot;I was blown away -- absolutely floored!&quot; Ballas, who hit the ground when they found out they won, told Us.\r\nSee photos of this season&apos;s DWTS contestants rehearsing.\r\nJohnson adds: &quot;Especially when they said less than one percent! I could not believe it!&quot;  Why did they deserve the top prize?  &quot;Shawn has improved every week, [and] she&apos;s really peaked over the last three weeks with the samba, the tango -- they all showed consistent improvement,&quot; Ballas told Us. &quot;Then we came out and gave everything we had to the freestyle. and that she has struggled with body image issues her entire life.\r\n&quot;When I was young, I would look at magazines and feel a lot of pressure,&quot; says the singer, 29. &quot;As a child of 12, I would write things in my journal like, &apos;I&apos;m lying here and all I can think about is that my stomach is hanging over my underwear.&apos; That disturbs me even today! I was always disconnected from myself; there was this idea of perfection I couldn&apos;t ever get to. But all women struggle with insecurity, and we all have something we don&apos;t like about ourselves.&quot;  \r\n\r\nSimpson - who underwent criticism this year after looking fuller-figured at a Florida concert - says she is psyched at the idea of hosting her own VH1 reality show, The Price of Beauty. The show tracks her journey around the world in search of what people find beautiful and why.\r\n&quot;No matter how much money you spend to make yourself beautiful--with all the products, the diets, the plastic surgery--in the end, women need to fall in love with themselves and realize they&apos;re beautifully and wonderfully made. There is no &apos;perfect&apos; you,&quot; says Simpson, who has admitted to getting Restylane to make her lips plumper.\r\n&quot;It will be interesting for women to see how self-obsessed we&apos;ve become,&quot; she says.\r\n\r\nShe credits ex Tony Romo with helping her become more comfortable in her own skin.   &quot;Tony never ever places judgment,&quot; she says. &quot;You can just relax and feel beautiful. He&apos;s just that type of person.&quot;  \r\n\r\nAlthough she did the interview before her split with Romo, she says, &quot;If this article comes out and we&apos;re not together, I&apos;d still love [Tony], and he&apos;d still be a huge part of who I am today.&quot;  \r\n\r\nSimpson also addresses her 2006 divorce from Nick Lachey.  &quot;It was hard to imagine I would ever walk down the aisle again,&quot; she says. &quot;It was like a death in the family: You go through the mourning stage, then the rebellion, and then all of a sudden you have to find life by yourself. Once you do that, you feel complete --and that&apos;s the only time you can truly fall in love again, and give yourself over completely to another person.&quot;\r\n\r\nAlthough her first marriage failed, says she will &quot;definitely&quot; wed again.\r\n&quot;I loved everything about marriage,&quot; she tells Glamour. &quot;I loved having a companion to wake up with and have barbecues with. But things happen and people grow apart. I don&apos;t really ever talk about the divorce because it was a heart-wrenching thing to go through. It&apos;s a very, very personal thing.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-body/news/jessica-simpson-ive-always-struggled-with-my-body-200948/#webpage"}, "image": As the Los Angeles Times reports that TLC is scrambling to find a way to revise the May 25 season premiere given the latest news on the couple, the delicate balancing act of how to incorporate reality into a heavily produced &quot;reality&quot; show is in the balance.  For the Gosselin clan, it&apos;s not just their show -- but their lifestyle -- that hang in the balance.   \nSee Jon and Kate through the years.\nKate, who grew up in a trailer park and didn&apos;t go on her first airplane ride until her honeymoon to Disney World, now flies only first class for speaking engagements (mostly paid for by churches), sells signed photos of her kids for $20 a pop at appearances, and received a free tummy tuck after giving birth (Jon received a free hair transplant). A family source says while pregnant with the sextuplets, she grew &quot;obsessed&quot; with how many goodies the famed McCaughey septuplets received in 1997.\nCheck out celebs caught cheating. \nJon, now a stay-at-home dad, was fired from his job at Style Craft Corp in 2004 after &quot;spending much more time&quot; on a &quot;quest&quot; for freebies than working, the company&apos;s owner, David Rothermel, tells Us. (Rothermel finally has spoken out after growing furious at the couple&apos;s well-worn claim that he was fired because the company didn&apos;t want to insure his family.)  \nSee photos of Jon Gosselin and his mistress\n&quot;Instead of keeping the attention on their kids, they&apos;ve let the attention turn to money and fame,&quot; says a family source of Jon and Kate, who, according to Nielson Media Research, are ranked No. 8 on the list of cable shows with the most product placement.  Marc Berman, senior television editor at Mediaweek, says producers cannot continue to portray the Gosselins as an everyday family trying to raise eight kids.  &quot;Their lives have changed - they&apos;re not struggling anymore,&quot; Berman tells Usmagazine.com. &quot;They&apos;re eating at fancy restaurants now. Yeah, they still have eight children, but things are different.  Below, a sample of just some of the swag they&apos;ve scored:  - Free beds - Front-loader washing machines - New furniture - Free solar panels for &quot;Going Green&quot; episode - Clothes from Gymboree and Gap - Mady &amp; Cara birthday at American Girl Place (2 dolls and birthday package for 2 adults &amp; 2 kids): $710 - Trip to Florida Key&apos;s for Jon&apos;s 30th birthday -Tickets to Dutch Wonderland amusement park: $309.50 -1/2 an organic cow from Natural Acres Farm: $1,395.00 -Tickets to Philadelphia Zoo: $104.00 -Tickets to Walt Disney World: $654.00 per day - Utah house rental (estimate: $5,000), ski lift tickets $72 for six days), ski school lessons ($140 per child) - Upright piano, which they got rid of when they moved into their new $1.1 million home : $5,550-$6,350 - Violin: $100-$300 - Old house re-carperted -Crayola Factory Tour: $90.00 -Teeth Whitening (for Jon &amp; Kate): $1,310 (average price for 2 adults) -Hair plugs (Jon): $5,200 (average cost) -Sesame game -LegoLand tickets: $550.00 -San Diego Zoo tickets: $278.00 -Grand Wailea Resort (Hawaii) for 2008 vow renewal: Suites range from $725-$1,080 per night. -2 purebred German Shepherd puppies: Everyone did,&quot; the Idol champ told MTV News. &quot;Live Like We&apos;re Dying&quot; will be available Sept. 29 on iTunes.American Idol&apos;s Adam Lambert, who finished second to Allen at the show&apos;s May finale, will release his first album Nov. 24 with backing from RCA Records.\r\nFind out more about the fall&apos;s hottest music releases at Usmagazine.com&apos;s Music/Movies/TV the American Idol runner-up says.\r\nLook back at the Season 8 Idol&apos;s finale most unforgettable moments.\r\n&quot;I&apos;m proud of my sexuality,&quot; continues the rocker, who was photographed holding hands with interior designer Drake LaBry earlier this month. &quot;I embrace it. It&apos;s just another part of me.&quot;\r\nCheck out photos of star couples who can&apos;t get enough of each other.\r\nBut Lambert, 27, from San Diego -- who performed Sam Cooke&apos;s &quot;A Change Is Gonna Come&quot; on the Idol finale --  says he&apos;s not the poster boy for gay rights.  &quot;I&apos;m trying to be a singer, not a civil rights leader,&quot; he tells RS contributor Vanessa Grigoriadis.  \r\nVIDEO: Adam Lambert talking to Rolling Stone about his cover shoot.\r\nLambert admits that he was nervous about coming out while Idol was still on the air because contestants are under a media embargo, and he wanted to do it on his &quot;own terms.&quot; (He also says producers were open to him handling it however he wanted to.)\r\n&quot;I was worried that [coming out] would be so sensationalized that it would overshadow what I was there to do, which was sing,&quot; Lambert tells the mag. &quot;I&apos;m an entertainer, and who I am and what I do in my personal life is a separate thing. it shouldn&apos;t matter. Except it does. It&apos;s really confusing.&quot;\r\nFind out what an Idol stylist has to say about Lambert&apos;s look.\r\nLambert credits the FOX reality show with helping him gain self confidence.  &quot;I finally checked into my self-worth for the first time in my life, and the fact that it coincided with Idol is so sweet,&quot; he says. &quot;I mean, I still have moments where I think, &apos;Oh, my skin is terrible, and I&apos;m a little fat -- I should really go to the gym more.&apos; But for the most part, when I look in the mirror now, I finally see somebody who can do something cool.&quot;\r\nSee before and after pics of Idol&apos;s weight winners (and losers).\r\nFor more details on which Idol Lambert is attracted to, how he came out to his family, and what was going through his head when Such action would put new limits on its distribution.\nFind out how Michael Jackson&apos;s pill addiction began.\n The Drug Enforcement Administration was petitioned two years ago to greater regulate propofol, a potent anesthetic, and to make it a so-called &quot;scheduled&quot; drug under the Controlled Substances Act. That designation is used to impose restrictions on distributing and prescribing certain drugs prone to abuse and addiction.\nSee 32 photos from inside Michael Jackson&apos;s Staples Center memorial.\nDEA spokesman Rusty Payne confirmed Wednesday that the agency is considering adding propofol (the brand name version is Diprivan) to that list.\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years.\n Until Jackson&apos;s death, the main concern about propofol was its potential for abuse by medical staff because it is usually administered intravenously in hospitals to Playwright David Mamet slammed Piven for &quot;leaving show business to pursue a career as a thermometer,&quot; but, in his new statement below, the Entourage star points out mercury poisoning was &quot;recently described by the Obama administration...as the world&apos;s gravest chemical problem.&quot;\nSee photos of big celeb scandals.\n Piven is slated to go before an arbitrator on June 8 and 9.  His statement, released to BroadwayWorld.com Wednesday, reads:  &quot;After Mr. Piven was diagnosed with a potentially toxic Mercury level, he reluctantly left SPEED-THE-PLOW at the insistence of his doctors, who warned him that enforced rest was required to avoid severe medical problems, including a heart attack. Mr. Piven is looking forward to testifying in Arbitration along with his doctors so that the truth comes out about the very health serious risks caused by Mercury exposure, which the Obama administration has recently described as the world&apos;s gravest chemical problem.\nCheck out the day&apos;s top news photos.\nStarting back in December, Mr. Piven repeatedly offered to turn over his medical records to the Producers subject to an appropriate confidentiality agreement. The Producers repeatedly rejected that proposal. It is obvious that the Producers did not really want the medical records Mr. Piven volunteered to provide, since those records would confirm the medical necessity of his withdrawal from the show. The Producers&apos; recent statement claiming that they had offered to keep the medical records private is nothing more than PR &quot;spin.&quot; We have confirmed with Actors Equity today that the Union is not aware of any such confidentiality proposal by the Producers.  In addition to repeatedly offering his medical records subject to a confidentiality agreement to prevent the Producers from disseminating them to the media, Mr. Piven had also repeatedly offered to be examined by a doctor designated by the Producers both before, during and after his hospitalization for toxic Mercury levels. The Producers never took him up on that offer.  The fact that the Producers issued a statement announcing the Arbitration dates suggests that this is part of a punitive strategy to intimidate actors so that they ignore serious health symptoms and he begins. &quot;Since February my attorney has advised me not to speak out, even though since the incident I wanted to publicly express my deepest regret and accept full responsibility.  &quot;Although I would do some interviews and answer some questions in the future, I felt it was time you heard directly from me that I am sorry. I have tried to live my life in a way that would make those around me proud of me, and until recently, I think I was doing a pretty good job. I wish I had the chance to live those few moments again, but unfortunately I can&apos;t.&quot;  &quot;I cannot go into what happened, and most importantly, I&apos;m not going to sit here and make any excuses. I take great pride in me being able to exercise self-control and what I did was inexcusable. I am very sad and very ashamed of what I&apos;ve done.\r\nSee Chris Brown and Rihanna through the years\r\n&quot;My mother and my spiritual teachers have taught me way better than that. I recognize that I&apos;ve truly been blessed. I&apos;ve been blessed with a wonderful family, wonderful friends and fans. God has been generous in giving me the ability which has brought me fame and fortune.  &quot;I have done a lot of soul-searching, and over the past several months I&apos;ve talked with my minister and my mother, and I spent a lot of time trying to understand what happened and why. I have let a lot of people down, and I realize that.\r\nSee stars who have survived abuse\r\n&quot;No one is more disappointed than in me than I am. As many of you know, I grew up in a home where there was domestic violence and I saw firsthand what uncontrolled rage could do. I have sought and am continuing to seek help to ensure that what occurred in February can never happen again.  &quot;As I sit here today I can tell you that I will do everything in my power to make sure that it never happens again, and I promise that. What I did was unacceptable, 100 percent. I can only ask and pray that you forgive me, please. I hope that others learn from my mistakes. I intend to live my life so that I am truly worthy of the term &apos;role model.&apos; Thank you,&quot; Brown concludes.\r\nSee Rihanna through the years\r\nLast month, the 20-year-old singer pleaded guilty to felony assault by means likely to cause great bodily injury. You have to laugh.&quot;\nSee intimate photos from Heidi and Spencer&apos;s wedding\nConrad also reflects on her decision to leave The Hills, addressing the various perils of her fame.  &quot;The last three concerts I went to, I was removed by security because I was a fire hazard,&quot; she says. &quot;People crowd around you and you lose that whole personal-space concept.&quot;   &quot;My roommate went to Europe for two months, but I couldn&apos;t take a vacation without clearing it months and months ahead of time,&quot; she says, citing another downfall of starring on a reality show. &quot;My friends all got to date guys who didn&apos;t need to sign a release form.&quot;\nLook back at famous scandals involving The Hills stars\n Conrad also says filming &quot;affected the underwear I had to buy because I needed thicker underwear with a more sturdy band so it could hold up a microphone.&quot;  &quot;I couldn&apos;t wear whites or prints because they don&apos;t look good on film,&quot; she explains. &quot;I had to consult a director of photography when I picked the paint for my walls because I had to have set lighting in my living room and kitchen. Barack and Michelle Obama made their first trip to New York City since he took office, enjoying dinner and a Broadway play over the weekend.  After both parents attended eldest daughter Malia&apos;s soccer match (her team won), they boarded a C-20 plane and arrived in the Big Apple Saturday afternoon. (A White House press spokesperson said that the President had &quot;promised&quot; his wife that he would take her to a Broadway show after the election was all finished.)\nSee photos of Barack Obama&apos;s first 100 days in Washington\nTheir first stop? New York&apos;s West Village neighborhood, where they dined at Bluehill Restaurant.  Fellow diner Eva Fleischer of Manhattan said she &quot;had no idea&quot; the Obamas would be there when she made her 5:30 p.m. reservations.  &quot;They had to pat us down,&quot; she told reporters outside the restaurant, which is known for its  &quot;locally grown fare.&quot;  As the Obamas left, Fleischer recalled, the President said to her table, &quot;&apos;Hi, guys!&apos; It was very exciting because we didn&apos;t expect to see him here. It was really neat.&quot;\nSee the Obama family photo album\n Another diner, Susan Korchak of Manhattan, noted that Michelle &quot;is very tall. She&apos;s just statuesque and gorgeous.&quot;  Fan went wild as the two exited the restaurant. Blockades were set up to keep the crowds of people at bay on the streets. Several people weren&apos;t allowed to cross the street to get back to their apartment, but they were happy to wait it out. Dads had their kids up on their shoulders; others had their cameras out, hoping to catch a picture. There was even a helicopter flying in the sky.  Some onlookers remarked that it was like the inauguration all over again.\nSee all the stars who went to the inauguration\nAfter dinner, the Obamas then went to the Belasco Theater on West 44th Street, where they caught a performance of Joe Turner&apos;s Come and Gone - about a group of African-Americans coming to grips with the legacy of slavery - before flying back to the White House.", He just didn&apos;t want to live after that. You know, he had done everything ... he could possibly do for his daughter and she wanted no part of him once he couldn&apos;t do anything for her.&quot;\nSee then-and-now photos of your favorite 90210 stars\n Of her remarks, Candy said on The HuffingtonPost.com, &quot;I didn&apos;t intend to create headlines. I was asked a question about my daughter not speaking with my family, and I answered truthfully.&quot;  &quot;My husband was very ill, and he had stopped eating and taking liquids. We had to say no every day,&quot; she went on.\nSee Tori Spelling and other moms in bikinis\nOf making such an outlandish remark, Candy now says, &quot;I should have known better, but it is the truth.&quot;  Tori and Candy have been estranged for some time. Tori has never revealed the reason they don&apos;t talk. Instead, she has vaguely said they just &quot;don&apos;t go together.&quot;\nTake a peek at Tori and Dean&apos;s family photo album \n In April, Candy -- who released her frank memoir Stories From Candyland a few weeks before Tori debuted her book, Mommyhood -- posted a public letter to Tori on her website, pushing for a reconciliation. &quot;I want to see you and your family&#x201C; in private, like the &apos;normal family&apos; you say always wanted,&quot; pleaded Candy, who said she has met Tori&apos;s son Liam, 2, but never met daughter Stella, 11 months.  The HuffingtonPost.com Tori told Usmagazine.com in April: &quot;If I said one thing to my mother, it wouldn&apos;t be public because if she does intend to have a relationship with her grandchildren -- which I am totally open to -- I just would like her to approach us privately.&quot;\nSee Tori Spelling and other stars at fashion week!", "isPartOf": {"@id": from the 1950s musical Summer Stock, wearing an all-black ensemble similar to one Garland once wore.\nThe routine was conceived by Emmy-nominated choreographer and Holmes&apos; pal, Tyce Diorio.  At one point in the routine, Holmes -- who also pranced around in a black velvet fedora, nylon stockings and body-hugging skirt -- was lifted over three dancers&apos; heads.\nFor her finish, she tossed her hat in the air, and one of the other male dancers -- which included SYTYCD alums Mark Kanemura and Joshua Allen -- caught it.  \nCheck out photos of stars dancing!\nGarland&apos;s son, Joey Luft, was in attendance at Thursday&apos;s taping and saw Holmes&apos; tribute to his late mom.   &quot;I bet Judy Garland&apos;s giving [Katie] a standing ovation in heaven,&quot; Murphy said.\nHolmes signed on to perform for the show&apos;s 100th episode after judge/executive producer Nigel Lythgoe approached her to join the board of directors for his Dizzy Feet Foundation, which offers scholarships to underprivileged youth.\n&quot;She put herself out there and she didn&apos;t have to do that, so I&apos;m very delighted in her performance,&quot; Lythgoe told Us of the actress, who donated her full performance fee to Dizzy Feet Foundation.\n&quot;I think it is important to experience music and dancing and singing and the arts and sports,&quot; Holmes said on the show. &quot;This is the next generation. I think it is important to give them every opportunity to grow and discover what it is that they like and to have access to the best. &quot;  \nLook back at Katie Holmes&apos; most memorable roles\nAfter her TV performance, Lythgoe says Holmes has been bitten by the dancing bug.  &quot;Katie&apos;s really taken to dancing,&quot; the judge said. &quot;She is filming a movie in Australia for the younger kids,\" she says", "articleBody": "It&apos;s a non-stop party in the Jolie-Pitt household.  \nAngelina Jolie tells CNN&apos;s Anderson Cooper that she and Brad Pitt are constantly celebrating the birthdays of their six kids: Maddox, 7, Pax, 5, Zahara, 4, Shiloh, 3, and twins Knox and Viv, 11 months.\nSee adorable photos of the Jolie-Pitt kids, including the twins\n&quot;I do have the twins, and I just had Shi in May. We have so many kids that we just have year-round birthdays,&quot; Jolie said in an interview about World Refugee Day that aired last night. &quot;It&apos;s a lot of fun now &apos;cause the older kids are old enough to help plan the birthdays for the younger kids.\n&quot;So it&apos;s one of the great pleasures of life, the birthdays,&quot; she continued.  But Jolie (who donated $1 million to Pakistani refugees yesterday through her and Pitt&apos;s foundation) makes sure her kids understand they&apos;re fortunate.  \nDo you know who the most generous celebs are?\n&quot;Some of my kids are from countries that have seen conflict. I usually just explain to them that there are other families in the world that aren&apos;t as fortunate as ours and other kids,&quot; Jolie said.\n&quot;And so I tell them that it&apos;s important for all of us to do what we can and then go to these places and understand what&apos;s happening,&quot; she went on. &quot;So I think they&apos;re just being raised that this is the normal thing to do.... Hopefully I&apos;ll take them to as many countries as I can and raise them with an education of the world.&quot;  \nCheck out all the places where Angie has traveled\nJolie says that despite her position as a UNCHR Goodwill Ambassador, she&apos;s &quot;not a political person.\n&quot;But I think it doesn&apos;t take much to understand that this is the front line of us fighting against extremists, where all that we hold dear and all that we value is really on the line,&quot; she explained.\n&quot;This fight is a very personal fight for all of us. And these victims of this crisis, these regular people who are mostly agriculturalists that are fleeing are, you know, we should feel a real connection to them, identify with them.... dating, Khloe Kardashian and Los Angeles Lakers forward Lamar Odom have married, Usmagazine.com has confirmed.The ceremony, which began Sunday afternoon just after 5 p.m. with the traditional Wedding March, was held at the Los Angeles mansion of Kardashian family friend and music manager Irving Azoff.It is the first marriage for both Kardashian, 25, and Odom, 29, who has two children from a previous relationship.\r\n\r\nKardashian&apos;s immediate family members -- mom Kris Jenner, stepfather Bruce Jenner, sisters Kim, 28, and Kourtney, 30 and brother Robert -- were among the 200 guests, who received cupcakes in purple and yellow Lakers colors as favors.\r\nKardashian&apos;s bridesmaids wore short strapless lilac dresses.\r\nAlso in attendance were Odom&apos;s L.A. Lakers teammates, Ryan Seacrest, Kelly Osbourne, reality star Brittny Gastineau and TV personality LaLa Vasquez.\r\n&quot;I wish them the best, and I&apos;m sure they are going to have a great, happy, long marriage,&quot; Vasquez told Us at an event last Thursday.\r\n\r\nKardashian and Odom made their first public appearance Sept. 3 at West Hollywood club Guys and Dolls.&quot;Khloe is smart and beautiful, and that is very hard to find,&quot; Odom -- who recently signed a four-year, $33 million contract with the Lakers -- told Us at the time.Why the rush to the altar?\r\n\r\nOdom&apos;s basketball schedule was one issue. (The Lakers are set to play their first preseason game on Oct. 7.)&quot;Khloe and Lamar [wanted] to get married before Lamar has to go away for training, and the [basketball] season starts up [this fall],&quot; a source tells the new issue of Us Weekly.\r\n\r\nDespite the quickie nuptials, the pair will last, their friends tell Us.\r\n&quot;They are just a great couple,&quot; wedding guest Gastineau told Us last week. &quot;I think when you meet a couple, you can just tell if they work. And they work.&quot;\r\nAdded Lakers player Ron Artest, &quot;Love is strong, so I think it&apos;s cool. Then, two nights later in Vegas, Spears dined on sushi and vegetable dumplings (and more iced tea) with pals at Tao restaurant.   Indeed a change of pace may have been just what the doctor ordered.  &quot;After about three weeks to a month of not drinking alcohol and getting enough water and nutrients into your body, you&apos;ll easily look like a different person,&quot; NYC-based dermatologist Jeannette Graf tells Us, adding that Spears&apos; healthy new habits help increase circulation to the skin, accounting for that healthier glow. Two days after leaving rehab, Spears attended a hip-hop class at Millennium Dance Complex in L.A. &quot;When I saw her, she looked beautiful,&quot; instructor Darrien Henning tells Us. justice&quot; of Jenkins, 32, who appeared on VH1 reality shows Megan Wants a Millionaire and I Love Money.  He said Jenkins -- who is considered &quot;armed and dangerous&quot; -- may have escaped to his native Canada on foot after the nude body of his ex-wife, Jasmine Fiore, 28, was found stuffed into a suitcase in a Buena Park, Calif., trash bin over the weekend. It was also revealed that her teeth and fingers had been removed.  &quot;Ryan Jenkins is an animal,&quot; said Robert Hasman, a former boyfriend of Fiore&apos;s, who attended the conference with other relatives. &quot;What he has done to Jasmine is unspeakable.&quot;   \nLook back at Hollywood&apos;s ugliest splits.\nA warrant has been issued for his arrest, and $10 million bail has been set. It is still unclear if Jenkins -- who was named a &quot;person of interest&quot; earlier -- is charged with first-degree or second-degree murder, spokesperson Farrah Emami told Us Thursday.  A U.S. Marshall said his agency is cooperating with Canadian law enforcement to find Jenkins.  They are still investigating for motive.   In June, Jenkins was charged with a misdemeanor count of &quot;battery constituting domestic violence&quot; for hitting Fiore in the arm. He&apos;s due in court in December.  \nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\nJenkins -- who earned the nickname &quot;Smooth Operator&quot; on Megan Wants a Millionaire -- has a criminal history in his Calgary hometown, according to the Associated Press. After Split", "datePublished": "2009-06-12T13:32:29-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:55:40-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "One year after separating from her husband of 14 years, the singer says she's living life with a \"more optimistic attitude\"", "articleBody": "One year after her split from her husband, Shania Twain says she&apos;s &quot;managing very well, in fact.\n&quot;I&apos;m enjoying my child, friends and family like I haven&apos;t in years, and it&apos;s great...&quot; continues Twain in a letter to her fan club on her Web site.\nSee stars who look better after breakup.\n&quot;I&apos;ve been experiencing and seeing new things every day, living life with a different and more optimistic attitude,&quot; the singer goes on.\nTwain and Robert &quot;Mutt&quot; Lange separated in May 2008 following news of his affair with Marie-Anne Thiebaud, Twain&apos;s longtime friend and secretary.   At the time, Twain said: &quot;I need some time to heal this broken heart, but make no mistake: I will be back and hopefully stronger than ever.&quot;  \nLook back at Hollywood&apos;s ugliest divorces.\nThe country singer went on to dazzle at the Country Music Awards last November -- and debut her relationship with Thiebaud&apos;s ex husband, Patrick.\nIn her new letter to fans, Twain says she doesn&apos;t need to rehash the pain of her breakup.  &quot;The personal issues that took place just over a year ago have been well documented, and there&apos;s no need to go into more detail here,&quot; she writes. &quot;Since then, I&apos;ve been inspired by my pain to write and use writing as a therapy through the suffering. I truly wouldn&apos;t wish this on anybody as a means to get inspired, but it&apos;s been a productive period with so much emotion trying to find it&apos;s way out.&quot;\nShe&apos;s focused on songwriting and raising her 7-year-old son with Lange, Eja D&apos;Angelo, in Switzerland.\nSee the worst dressed country stars of all time.\n&quot;As many things as there have been to write about through this difficult time in my life, healing is serious business and has taken a lot of the wind out of my sails, slowing me down at times,&quot; she writes. &quot;As you know, I am a mom and all my energy goes to making sure my little man is healthy and happy in every way. This is a full time job, as any parent understands, but especially difficult when you are battling your own personal crisis at the same time while trying to spare your child of being affected by your own suffering.&quot;\n&quot;During this intense period, I was managing to hide my devastation from Eja and cried only when I was alone,&quot; she confesses.   &quot;One time when I was having a weak moment listening to some sad music and sobbing and slobbering over my computer&apos;s keyboard, Eja walked up behind me and asked me why I was crying,&quot; she goes on. &quot;He wasn&apos;t sad at first -- just totally surprised to see his mom crying (he is seven and never saw me cry before), and didn&apos;t know what to make of it.&quot;\n&quot;I was quick on my feet to answer him though and told Eja that music was very powerful and can make people quite emotional,&quot; Twain continues. &quot;It can make you want to dance, feel angry, happy or sad and that this song was sad and made me cry. He accepted this, hugged me and went back to what he was doing. Phew, that was tough!&quot;\nLife has returned to normal.  &quot;Each morning I put my son on the school bus, feed our two dogs Sony and Dolly, drink my orange juice and sit down at the computer to write,&quot; she says.\nHer songs &quot;often comes out in the form of poetry, diary notes or e-mails to friends,&quot; she says. &quot;I often go back to my e-mails for song ideas. When I write in letter form, I don&apos;t hold back.&quot;\nBut she&apos;s also taken a few chances.  &quot;I&apos;ve jumped out of an airplane at 10,000 feet, I&apos;m riding Spanish and Arabian horses, traveling to exotic places, I&apos;ve been deep sea diving for the first time!&quot; she writes. &quot;I pull the odd all-nighter, read more books, listen to Eja&apos;s favourite music with him, LOUD (ironically his favourite band is ACDC) and basically I&apos;m enjoying life.&quot;\nTwain is grateful to her fans.  &quot;The many blogs and e-mails have warmed my heart, strengthened my confidence, given me courage, and have often even made me laugh out loud&#xE2;&#x20AC;&#xA6;in a good way! I know I am not alone and realize through your support that you are all [rooting] for Eja and I, and our well-being.&quot;\n&quot;Time has a way of making everything right, and it is my hope that good music will eventually come out of it,&quot; she says, explaining the delay in putting out her next album. &quot;I say &apos;good music&apos; since I don&apos;t want to just throw anything at you, just for the sake of hurrying up to get it out.&quot;\nTwain signs off: &quot;Till next time, my friends. Be well, and peace and happiness to all of you. Love, Shania.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/shania-twain-managing-very-well-after-split-2009126/#webpage"}, "image": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": Williams, 29, says in Vogue&apos;s October issue (on newsstands now) about her former boyfriend, who died of an accidental drug overdose at the age of 28 in January 2008.\r\nShe adds: &quot;I can talk about grief because that&apos;s mine, about single parenting, about trying to balance work and kids. But what I don&apos;t have to talk about is what happened between Heath and me in our relationship.&quot;She and Ledger -- who met while filming Brokeback Mountain -- dated for three years before they amicably split in August 2007. The duo had a daughter, Matilda Rose, 3.\r\n\r\n&quot;Brokeback Mountain was an unrepeatable moment in time, a very charmed time in my life,&quot; she tells Vogue. &quot;I was in love. I was in a movie I was proud to be a part of, and with a beautiful brand-new baby. Everything was good in that moment.&#x201D;When he died, she struggled to cope.\r\n\r\n&quot;I was holding it together by a string and a paper clip in the fall and winter,&quot; she says. &quot;I didn&#x2019;t know if I could keep it all together&#x2026; You console yourself by saying it&#x2019;s all a deepening process. But it&#x2019;s wired. After the first year, the pain is less intense -- it&#x2019;s less immediate. But the magical thinking goes away too. And that&#x2019;s a whole new reckoning.&quot;Still, their child provided her strength. &quot;Every time I really miss him and wonder where he&#x2019;s gone, I just look at her,&quot; she says. \r\n\r\nIn July 2008, she began dating director Spike Jonze but admits it hasn&apos;t been easy.&quot;I thought falling in love again was the only thing that was going to save me from the pain,&quot; she laments. &quot;This erroneous idea: It just makes things more complicated.&#x201D;&#xA0;Of the future, she says: &quot;I feel hopeful and grateful. Her program included a diet of 1,200 calories a day and 30-45 minutes of activity up to four times a week.\r\nCheck out these scary skinny bikini bods\r\nThe actress, 61, plans to show off her new svelte shape in a new Jenny Craig commercial titled &quot;Uphill Battle,&quot; beginning Aug. 29.\r\n\r\n&quot;The most rewarding thing about reaching my goal weight is that I feel so much lighter,&quot; she said in a released statement. &quot;There&apos;s just an overall sense of well-being. And there&apos;s the increased energy as well. It&apos;s nice to have people say you look nice. Who knew losing weight could be so much fun?&quot;\r\n\r\nAdded Steve Bellach, Jenny Craig marketing executive: &quot;We are so proud of Phylicia&apos;s success. As the public saw her journey unfold on television, Phylicia remarked that the one part of the Jenny Craig program she didn&apos;t think she needed, a personal consultant, turned out to be the key to her 35-pound weight-loss success. https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/farrah-fawcett-dies-of-cancer-at-62-2009256/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/farrah-fawcett-dies-of-cancer-at-62-2009256/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/farrah-fawcett-dies-of-cancer-at-62-2009256/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Farrah Fawcett Dies of Cancer at 62", "datePublished": "2009-06-25T13:10:57-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:56:04-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "\"We take comfort in the beautiful times that we shared with Farrah,\" beau Ryan O'Neal tells Us", "articleBody": "Farrah Fawcett, a former pinup girl who skyrocketed to fame as private investigator Jill Munroe on the 1970s television hit Charlie&apos;s Angels, has died. She was 62.\nThe actress passed away Thursday at 9:28 a.m. PST at Saint John&apos;s Hospital in Santa Monica, Calif., after a two-and-a-half year battle with cancer. She was with longtime partner Ryan O&apos;Neal, friend Alana Stewart and her doctor Lawrence Piro.   \nTake a look back at the life of Farrah Fawcett\n&quot;After a long and brave battle with cancer, our beloved Farrah has passed away,&quot; O&apos;Neal said in a statement to Usmagazine.com. &quot;Although this is an extremely difficult time for her family and friends, we take comfort in the beautiful times that we  shared with Farrah over the years and the knowledge that her life brought joy to so many people around the world.&quot;\nA forlorn O&apos;Neal, wearing a Lance Armstrong Live Strong bracelet, was spotted leaving the hospital Thursday, telling photographers, &quot;She&apos;s gone.&quot;\nRemember those stars who died last year \nCAREER HIGHS\nBorn Feb. 2, 1947 in Corpus Christi, Texas, Fawcett, a former college beauty queen, was discovered by a talent scout shortly after moving to Hollywood in the 1960s. She went on to appear in countless commercials and had guest roles on a variety of television shows.\nBut her career took off in the 1970s -- shortly after she wed actor Lee Majors (they divorced in 1982) -- when she appeared in now-iconic posters wearing a red one-piece bathing suit.\nSee more of today&apos;s top celeb news photos\nIn 1976, she landed a role as sporty undercover detective Jill Munroe on Charlie&apos;s Angels.  She left Angels after only one year and began taking on more serious roles.\nShe received an Emmy nod for her portrayal of a battered wife in the 1984 TV movie The Burning Bed and received two more Emmy nominations for her roles as a predator in the miniseries Small Sacrifices and in 2004&apos;s The Guardian.\nThroughout her career, the actress -- who caused a stir when she posed for Playboy in 1995 and, again, in 1997 at the age of 50 -- always downplayed her looks.\n&quot;God gave women intuition and femininity,&quot; Fawcett once said. &quot;Used properly, the combination easily jumbles the brain of any man I&apos;ve ever met.&quot;  \nA BRAVE BATTLE\nIn 2006, Fawcett revealed she had anal cancer. Although she appeared to be cancer-free a year later, the disease returned, spreading to her liver, despite seeking alternative medical treatments in Germany.\n&quot;Cancer is a disease that is mysterious, headstrong and makes its own rules. And mine, to this date, is incurable,&quot; Fawcett said on the NBC documentary Farrah&apos;s Story that aired this past spring.\n&quot;I know that everyone will die eventually, but I do not want to die of this disease. I want to stay alive,&quot; she went on. &quot;So I say to God, because it is, after all, in his hands. It is seriously time for a miracle.&quot;  \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon \nLOVE STORY\nFawcett and O&apos;Neal began dating in 1980 and have lived together for years. They have a son, Redmond, 24, who is currently serving a prison term in California after repeated drug offenses.\nDespite proposing to her countless times, she always told him no.  But earlier this week, O&apos;Neal told Barbara Walters: &quot;I&apos;ve asked her to marry me, again, and she&apos;s agreed.   He said they &quot;will&quot; wed &quot;as soon as she can, say yes.&quot;\nIn May, O&apos;Neal told NBC News that he has fallen more in love with Fawcett as he watched her bravely battle cancer.\n&quot;I know this, that in the last two years I loved her more than I&apos;ve ever loved her - ever,&quot; he told Meredith Vieira. &quot;She&apos;s so much more of a woman ... powerful, courageous, fearless and all those adjectives. And I look at her with awe.&quot;\nIn lieu of flowers the family has asked that donations to support cancer  research be made to:  The Farrah Fawcett Foundation P.O. Box 6478 Beverly Hills, CA  90212.", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/farrah-fawcett-dies-of-cancer-at-62-2009256/#webpage"}, "image": {"@type": "ImageObject", the hospital says.\r\nSee Octo Mom&apos;s family album.\r\nAlthough Josiah&apos;s release went off relatively without incident, the day got off to a hectic start, beginning with a panicked 911 call.  Sources say that around 3 in the morning, Octomom&apos;s house got vandalized by some uninvited April Fools pranksters.     In a statement issued on Wednesday evening, a spokesman for the La Habra Police Department verified that police units were dispatched to the Suleman home on Madonna Lane shortly after 7 A.M. Wednesday.\r\n&quot;A nanny heard a loud noise around 3 A.M.  She looked outside and saw a large white cargo van speeding away. The nannies did not call the police or go outside at that time,&quot; according to Lt. Tom Dutton of L.H.P.D.&apos;s Media Relations office. &quot;When the morning nannies arrived for work at 6:30 A.M. they saw the rear window of [the] Suleman van had been smashed and a car seat appeared to have been thrown through the window,&quot; Dutton said.\r\nThe car seat apparently was from another one of the Suleman&apos;s vehicles and had been positioned outside on the porch next to the front door. The police report listed the damage to the van as a shattered window, a broken rear window wiper arm and a dent to the rear cargo door.    No suspects were reported and no other witnesses could be located.\r\nSee photos of all eight octuplets!\r\n&quot;Every day that passes is a milestone in the lives and care of the octuplets,&quot; Dr. Mandhir Gupta says. &quot;Being able to send another baby home is a significant step in their development.&quot; Jonah -- the last octuplet at the hospital -- &quot;continues to progress well and remains at Kaiser Permanente Bellflower Medical Center.  He continues gaining weight and remains on formula and donated pasteurized breast milk.&quot;\r\nFind out what the Octo Mom does all day.\r\nSuleman, 33, brought home her first two babies, Noah and Isaiah on March 17. On March 21, she welcomed home Maliyah and Nariyah. Makai and Jeremiah were released on March 26. His ongoing custody battle with ex Denise Richards over their daughters, Sam, 3, and Lola, 2.    In recently leaked court papers filed by Richards, 36, she claimed that Sheen&apos;s engagement to Mueller, 29, a real-estate investor, was a media stunt. She also claimed Sheen sent her emails calling her &quot;a sad jobless pig&quot; and telling her to &quot;go cry to your bald mom&quot; (her mother is undergoing chemotherapy treatments), among other nasty allegations.  For his part, Sheen has denied those claims and has also asked a judge for the ability to choose his own child care providers for daughters when they are with him and Mueller.  &quot;It&apos;s just so unfortunate because what&apos;s been lost in the entire, this ridiculous and unnecessary circus, is that the initial request was just to be able to hire my own nanny,&quot; he said. &quot;That&apos;s all I asked for and an extra weekend ... cut to two months later, this is what I&apos;m forced to deal with.&quot; Still, Sheen is keeping a sense of humor about the whole ordeal. Polanski&apos;s arrest has said to have been sought globally for the past four years.\r\n&quot;There was a valid arrest request and we knew when he was coming,&quot; ministry spokesman Guido Balmer told The Associated Press. &quot;That&apos;s why he was taken into custody.&quot; Balmer also added that the U.S. needs to make a formal extradition request.\r\nSee the day&apos;s top celeb news photos.\r\nIn the statement released by Swiss authorities, Polanski is said to be in &quot;provisional detention for extradition,&quot; but will not be transferred to U.S. authorities until all proceedings are completed. He has the right to contest his detention and any extradition decision in Swiss courts.The filmmaker, who helmed such projects as Rosemary&apos;s Baby and 2002&apos;s The Pianist, fled the U.S. in the 70s after pleading guilty to unlawful sexual intercourse with a 13-year-old. Polanski, who has lived for the last 30 years in France, left the country before his sentencing, and has since asked a judge to dismiss the case against him.\r\n\r\nEarlier this year, a California judge demanded Polanski return to the U.S. in order to formally apply for the case&apos;s dismissal, but when he refused to appear in person for fear of being arrested as a fugitive, Superior Court
