https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/michael-jacksons-memorial-speakers-hardly-knew-him-200997/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/michael-jacksons-memorial-speakers-hardly-knew-him-200997/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/michael-jacksons-memorial-speakers-hardly-knew-him-200997/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Michael Jackson&#8217;s Memorial Speakers Hardly Knew Him", "datePublished": "2009-07-09T15:06:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T20:59:39-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Brooke Shields hadn't seen him in 18 years; John Mayer, Queen Latifah \"never met\" him", "articleBody": "The majority of boldfaced names at Michael Jackson&apos;s July 6 memorial at Los Angeles&apos; Staples Center hadn&apos;t spoken to the the singer in years.\r\nMany never even met him at all.  \r\nBrooke Shields - who broke down in tears as she remembered her &quot;true friend&quot; - last saw Jackson (whom she met as a teenager) 18 years ago at Elizabeth Taylor&apos;s 1991 wedding. (At the memorial, she recalled how the two of them sneaked into Taylor&apos;s room for a peek at her dress.)  \r\n \r\nCorey Feldman -- who befriended Jackson in the 1980s -- also hadn&apos;t talked to the star in several years after having a falling out. Feldman ended up wearing a Jackson costume to the ceremony. &quot;I&apos;m just drained,&quot; he told Us.\r\nMany of Jackson&apos;s close friends were no-shows: Macaulay Culkin, ex-wife Lisa Marie Presley, Webster&apos;s Emmanuel Lewis, among others.  \r\nQuincy Jones, Jackson&apos;s longtime producer, and Diana Ross -- who was named in Jackson&apos;s will as a backup guardian to Jackson&apos;s three children -- also skipped the ceremony. Ross said she was at the memorial &quot;in spirit,&quot; but that she &quot;decided to pause and be silent&quot; because it &quot;feels right.&quot;\r\n\r\nArnold Klein, Jackson&apos;s longtime dermatologist and biological father to his two oldest children, was also noticeably absent. Debbie Rowe, mother of Jackson&apos;s two eldest children, said she skipped because she felt she&apos;d &quot;be an unnecessary distraction.&quot;\r\nAs for Elizabeth Taylor? She said she stayed home because she didn&apos;t want to &quot;be a part of the public whoopla.&quot;\r\nEven Jesse Jackson, who counseled the singer during his trial, was not present to speak. (A source tells Us Joe Jackson dislikes him and made sure Rev. Al Sharpton -- who laughed about Jackson during a 2008 discussion on race -- delivered a speech instead.)  \r\n\r\nInstead, most of the people who paid tribute to Jackson at Tuesday&apos;s memorial never met him at all.  \r\nQueen Latifah, who eulogized the singer, told David Letterman: &quot;I never actually got to meet him. My partner met him because we managed Naughty by Nature and they did a remix with him. He thought I had beautiful cheekbones.&quot;  \r\nJohn Mayer -- who performed an instrumental version of &quot;Human Nature&quot; -- told Larry King he also &quot;never met&quot; the King of Pop. His only connection was listening to Thriller as a teen. He said the Jackson family asked him to perform. (The Los Angeles Times&apos; Ann Powers remarked, &quot;I don&apos;t know why John Mayer is here. Was Slash not available?&quot;)\r\n\r\nJennifer Hudson -- who performed &quot;Will You Be There&quot; -- also had no prior relationship with Jackson. Mariah Carey covered the Jackson 5 classic &quot;I&apos;ll Be There,&quot; which she sang at the memorial. Though she worked with Jackson on his 2001 charity single &quot;What More Can I Give?&quot; she wasn&apos;t close with the singer, a source tells Us.  \r\nUsher, who sobbed and touched Jackson&apos;s coffin while singing &quot;Gone Too Soon,&quot; performed with Jackson at his 2001 celebration concert at New York City&apos;s Madison Square Garden. But &quot;their contact was minimal,&quot; the source tells Us, even though Usher has stated how influential Jackson was on his career.\r\nTwelve-year-old Britain&apos;s Got Talent finalist Shaheen Jafargholi&apos;s connection to Jackson? He toured as a young Jackson in the Thriller Live show and sang the Jackson 5 cover version of &quot;Who&apos;s Loving You&quot; on Britain&apos;s Got Talent.", "isPartOf": {"@id": Designer Posen was equally smitten, telling Usmagazine.com: &quot;Gwyneth is a fashion legend, the ultimate movie star. Her gown was romantic, sophisticated and sexy. I&apos;ve always dreamed of working with her, she is our American Princess.&quot;&#xA0;\r\nAl Gore, star of the Best Documentary winner An Inconvenient Truth may have been less sultry, but he was no less popular; fans in the stands yelled down to the former veep, &quot;Run for president!&quot;&#xA0;\r\nSacha Baron Cohen, 35, heard some encouraging words of his own, which he apparently needed after losing the Best Adapted Screenplay award to The Departed. Entering the lobby of the Kodak Theater, Cohen conferred with Hollywood heavy Harvey Weinstein who told the de-mustached Borat &quot;Don&apos;t worry. You win some, you lose some. You&apos;ll have more chances.&quot;   Cohen then got even more homestyle comfort from his mom. Cohen&apos;s parents found their son in the lobby, hugged and kissed him and told him not to worry about not winning this one. Not only is she a super-sweet mom for saying that, but we hear she is the No. 4 prostitute in all of Kazakhstan.\r\nAfter the show, Usmgazine.com ran into Sumner Redstone, CEO of Viacom, who bounced Tom Cruise on his cute little behind this summer. Redstone called an end to Paramount&apos;s long relationship with Cruise&apos;s production company and publicly called Cruise&apos;s couch-jumping behavior &apos;erratic.&apos;&#x9D;  But when we talked to Redstone after the Oscars, he promised to be all sunshine and moonbeams - or at least, not a jerk.  Sumner said he&apos;d &quot;love to see&quot; Cruise. Asked what he&apos;d say if he ran into his former cash cow, Sumner said he&apos;d tell Cruise, &quot;&apos;Hello, it is good to see you Tom. Every [news]paper, the headline was &apos;fat, fat, fat.&apos;&quot;\r\n\r\nHer body image issues weren&apos;t the only ones she was struggling with. Around that time in 2003, her half-sister, Yetunde Price, was shot and killed in L.A., outside the tennis courts where Williams and her sister Venus once played. The ordeal &quot;was really, really difficult&quot; for Williams. Williams channeled that pain into an upcoming memoir, On the Line.&quot;It talks about my journey through that whole situation, playing again when everyone said I couldn&apos;t do it,&quot; she said. &quot;They said I&apos;d never be No. 1, they said I&apos;d never win another grand slam.&quot;\r\n\r\nHer introspection helped, she told Banks, adding that she wrote herself &quot;little notes&quot; about &quot;the importance of staying positive.&quot;Williams admitted that she does not read her own press and has instead stored all those clippings away until she is retired from the game -- and ready to deal with them.&quot;You have to enjoy what you look like,&quot; she said. &quot;Sometimes I read things [that say] I&apos;m too fit or my arms are too muscular, but that&apos;s how I am. This is me, I love me. I think every person out there -- man, woman, regardless of age or gender -- needs to love themselves.&quot;\r\n\r\nThat love, she said, even extends to her competitors. Williams, who recently made headlines when she verbally assaulted a line judge during her U.S. Open match, asserts that she is most sorry about letting down those who have supported her. &quot;I play with a lot of fire, and I play with a lot of passion for everything I do,&quot; Williams said. &quot;I think the worst part was the fans missed out on seeing the end of an amazing match. We played over two hours of amazing tennis.&quot;To see Banks&apos; entire interview with Williams -- including a segment in which they play a game of tennis on the streets of NYC -- tune in to The Paramedic Tarino Lightbourne was charged Monday with conspiracy to commit extortion and attempted extortion for allegedly demanding $25 million to keep the document private. (As TMZ points out, it is unclear why Lightbourne thought the document was worth $25 million, as it was irrelevant to Jett&apos;s death.)\r\nCheck out never-seen photos John Travolta has released of his late son, Jett\r\nFormer Bahamian Senator Pleasant Bridgewater, who is also accused of trying to extort money from the Travolta family, said she plans to fight &quot;untrue and unfair charges&quot; against her. Enter here!\r\nSchefft, 32, met Waterman, 35, four years after giving up on reality TV romance.\r\n&quot;We clicked early on, and it happened so fast,&quot; she told Usmagazine.com in April. &quot;We just got along so well, and it was so easy. I never worried when I&apos;d see him again or when he&apos;d call.&quot;\r\nHe proposed this past September, but a month after they got engaged Schefft was laid off from her sales job. She became determined to have a low-cost -- but high-style -- wedding.\r\n\r\n(In fact, during an exclusive Us Weekly photo shoot, she tried on gorgeous gowns under $1,000 -- and shared her best budget tips!)  The small ceremony -- which she promised wouldn&apos;t include any Bachelor roses -- included fewer than 100 guests.\r\n&quot;You don&apos;t want to exclude anyone, but ultimately I just wanted close friends and family,&quot; she said. &quot;It&apos;s about Joe and me, not entertaining 400 people.&quot;\r\n\r\nAbove all, Schefft told Us what was most important to her on the big day.\r\n&quot;Getting married to Joe and sharing that with everybody we love and the people who love us,&quot; she said. &quot;And the first time I see him and I&apos;m in my wedding dress and he&apos;s at the end of the aisle -- I&apos;m very excited for that moment!&quot;\r\n\r\n Before she found her soulmate in Waterman, Schefft was the winner of The Bachelor&apos;s third season and engaged to Andrew Firestone. Wild partying soon followed.\r\n\r\n\"It was like Risky Business for 10 years,\" he says of the nineties. \"My parents were out of town, they left me a bunch of money, the car, and the house, and I didn't know when they were coming home. I'd worked so hard that by the time I was 20, I wanted to play hard. And I did that really well.\"\r\n\r\nSee then-and-now photos of your favorite TV stars\r\n\r\n\"I was never at a place where rehab would have been appropriate,\" he says of his drug use. \"Booze was what would make me want to stay out all night and do some blow or smoke a joint or whatever, so shutting that off was key. It's like ketchup and French fries \u2013 I don't want one without the other.\"\r\n\r\nHe went on to wed actress Amanda Anka, whom he'd known since he was 18. But his partying didn't stop.\r\n\r\nSee your favorite child stars all grown up\r\n\r\nAfter coming home late one night, his wife finally gave him an ultimatum: Quit partying.\r\n\r\nBut he didn't entirely stop. Things got so bad that she even took a planned holiday in Mexico without him. It was then, alone on a rainy Christmas morning, that he decided to go to an AA meeting.\r\n\r\nSee unforgettable celeb scandals\r\n\r\nLooking back, Bateman tells Details, \"Do you want to continue being great at being in your twenties, or do you want to step up and graduate into adulthood?\"\r\n\r\nHe and his wife welcomed their first daughter, Francesca, in October 2006.\r\n\r\nJennifer Aniston \u2013 Bateman's costar in the upcoming comedy The Baster (out next spring) \u2013 met him 15 years ago on a group ski trip to Aspen. She said she is proud at how far he's come.\r\n\r\nSee photos of Jennifer Aniston smooching Jason Bateman \u2013 and more celeb PDA\r\n\r\n\"He should be here, he's meant to be here, and for whatever reason, it's taken until now,\" she says. \"There's no bull**** with him. Even though he was pretty wild in those days, something about those dimples and that sweet face made you go, 'Oh, it's okay that you just drove up the street backwards in a Range Rover with the door wide open.' I don't know what was happening there. (She&apos;s set to host VH1 Divas Thursday night.)\r\n&quot;I am doing so many things, I can&apos;t wait to tell you,&quot; she said. &quot;I see myself...such a big part of what I&apos;ve been doing is helping other people realize their dreams. I&apos;ve only scratched the surface of things I want to do.&#xA0;\r\n\r\n&quot;I&apos;m going to be producing my own shows -- not just in America. I&apos;m going to be creating a show in Vegas. I can take it.&quot;\nSee memorable photos of Jennifer Aniston and Brad Pitt\nShe says she&apos;s fully supportive of &quot;anybody who is in a place that&apos;s not their strongest [but] is ready to push forward.&quot;\n&quot;If I&apos;m the emblem for &apos;this is what it looks like to be the lonely girl getting on with her life,&apos; so be it,&quot; says the actress, who was recently linked to Bradley Cooper following splits with Vince Vaughn, Paul Sculfor and John Mayer.\n&quot;I can make fun of myself. And I&apos;ll bring it up as long as the world is bringing it up.&quot;  \nSee what a body language expert had to say about Jennifer Aniston&apos;s fling with John Mayer\n She says she&apos;s always used humor to get her through tough situations.\n&quot;I remember being 7 and asking my mom if I was as pretty as [my best friend] Monique,&quot; she recalls. &quot;And with all the love in the world, my mom looked at me and said, &apos;Oh, honey, you&apos;re so funny.&apos; So, she doesn&apos;t lie to me . . . She answers the question by not answering and instead tells me what she thinks is my greatest strength.&quot;  \nSee Jennifer Aniston&apos;s bikini bod through the years\nHer parents made each other laugh &quot;like nobody&apos;s business,&quot; she says. &quot;I put a lot of value in that at a very young age.&quot;\nBut that hasn&apos;t always easy: Her father, soap star John, left her mom, Nancy, when she was 9.  \nLook back at Jennifer Aniston&apos;s most famous red carpet looks\nSays the actress, &quot;My dad walking out and not seeing him for a year and not knowing where he was . . . In an interview on 104.7 FM&apos;s Johnjay and Rich Show, the American Idol judge, 46, admits she fell for one of Sacha Baron Cohen&apos;s pranks in his upcoming film Bruno. (Cohen plays flamboyantly gay Austrian in the comedy, out July 10.)  Abdul says she received a call that she had won &quot;Artist of the Year&quot; in Germany.  When she arrived for a sit-down, &quot;I&apos;m greeted by this futuristic, Captain Nemo&#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x201C;looking dude with a mohawk -- and he&apos;s flaming,&quot; recalls Abdul, who said she never signed a release (her publicist did).  &quot;I&apos;m like, &apos;OK, this is weird. Is this a variety show or something like that?&apos;&quot; she went on.\nSee Paula Abdul&apos;s wackiest outfits of all time\n&quot;So I walk in and there was no furniture except for a chair. And I&apos;m waiting and waiting,&quot; she continued. &quot;And this guy Bruno introduces himself, and I said, &apos;Hi.&apos; And he said, &apos;Here, have some food.&apos; And the food looked horrible! And I said, &apos;No, I&apos;m fine.&apos; And he said, &apos;It&apos;s very, very, very good.&apos; I said, &apos;That&apos;s Ok, I don&apos;t want to have it.&apos;&quot;  Abdul said Bruno then apologized for not having furniture for the interview.  &quot;He snaps his fingers and says, &apos;Gardeners!&apos;&quot; she recalled. &quot;And these two Mexican guys come in, and they drop down to all fours. I see him paying them like 10 bucks. They drop down to all fours and he says [to me], &apos;Sit down.&apos;&quot; And I said, &apos;I&apos;m not doing that!&apos;&quot;\nCheck out more celeb embarrassing moments\nAfter all, Abdul said, she was in a dress.  &quot;So I&apos;m tipping and holding my core muscles to not sit on them. And he pushes me down on them, and I&apos;m like, &apos;I&apos;m sorry!&apos;&quot; she said.    It got even more bizarre, Abdul said, when he kicked one of them and they all fell on the ground.  &quot;It was getting so uncomfortable!&quot; she said. &quot;I&apos;m throwing daggers with my eyes at my publicist. And they&apos;re kicking my publicist out. And I said, &apos;Get me out of here. This is crazy. This is not funny, this is discrimination. This is abusive stuff going on here!&apos;&quot;  \nCheck out these celebs goofing off\n&quot;And he says, &apos;I need you to change your clothes,&apos; and I said, &apos;No, I won&apos;t be doing that. I have to go to work ... And by the way, where&apos;s my award?&quot;  Abdul - who had to go to an Idol taping - then dashed out.  &quot;As I&apos;m going to my car, they&apos;re chasing me with cameras,&quot; she said. &quot;And I&apos;m like, &apos;Oh God, this is so awkward.&apos; And I&apos;m trying to hold a smile on my face and the guy, Bruno, is running down the street in front of the car.&quot;  &quot;It was hysterical, but it was so disturbing,&quot; added Abdul. &quot;I was so mad at my publicist at that point. I said, &apos;I can&apos;t believe you signed [the release].&apos; And my manager and attorney were trying to call the production office -- and, of course, it doesn&apos;t exist. So I was freaking out.&quot;  A year went by, she said.  Then, her manager got a call three weeks ago from a reporter who heard that she had fallen for one of Sacha Baron Cohen&apos;s stunts.  &quot;I said, &apos;I&apos;ve never done anything with Sacha Cohen ... they&apos;re wrong!&apos;&quot; she said. &quot;At 2 o&apos;clock in the morning that night, I woke up in a cold sweat. I popped my body up out of bed and I went, &apos;Holy crap! Oh my God!&apos; And that&apos;s what happened. And I&apos;m dying. Cause you don&apos;t expect it. You just don&apos;t expect it.&quot;\nFind out what Paula Abdul&apos;s signature says about her\nAdded Abdul, &quot;Like I said, I thought it was just one of those Japanese TV shows where they do Two days later - while taking 8-year-old twins Cara and Mady to see Disney&apos;s Up -- he donned a pair of $150 Ed Hardy jungle-inspired jeans (featuring two angry tigers on the rear).  &quot;He seems to love our clothing,&quot; Tara Malia Gregory, the company&apos;s marketing director, previously told Usmagazine.com. (Gosselin&apos;s originally slated interview on E! has been canceled, a spokesperson said earlier.)  &quot;We had plans to travel together, to live together, and to be together,&quot; Major, who dined with Gosselin in NYC and in the Hamptons throughout July, said. &quot;He made his decision in the Hamptons. He wanted to be with me.&quot;\r\nGet to know Kate Major and Jon&apos;s other women.\r\nLast week, however, Gosselin reportedly said his relationship with Major was strictly platonic. He event told Usmagazine.com that he was still with his 22-year-old girlfriend. (&quot;My heart is always with Hailey [Glassman],&quot; he told Us.)  But according to Major, Gosselin told her he was going to break up with girlfriend Glassman in order to be with her. As a result, the 26-year-old resigned from her job, citing a &quot;conflict of interest.&quot;  &quot;I was with the person I was reporting on,&quot; Major said. &quot;He&apos;s the one who actually told me to quit my job... He told me he was going to Massachusetts to break up with [Glassman]. I know the truth. He knows the truth. Unfortunately, she did not.&quot;\r\nSee photos of Jon and Haily Glassman in France.\r\nShe even said that the newly single star attempted to date them both.  &quot;He tried to two-time both of us,&quot; she said. &quot;He wasn&apos;t honest with Hailey. He needs to man up and tell the truth. I&apos;m not going to be the other woman.&quot;  She added: &quot;In no way did he tell me he was going to go parade with his ex-girlfriend.&quot;  Because Gosselin has denied they ever dated, Major said the resulting claims that she lied to get media attention have been hard to handle.\r\nLook back at photos of Jon and Kate Gosselin through the years.\r\n&quot;It&apos;s been a nightmare. I did not want to have to do this,&quot; she said. &quot;I did not want to have to sell him out, but when he makes me look like a liar, a fool, and an idiot. I have to speak out.&quot;  Major also told E! News that she has proof they had a romantic relationship.  &quot;I was not the only one who was around when we were romantically involved,&quot; she said. &quot;We were holed up together. It&apos;s not like we were just sitting there doing an interview.&quot;  For the full interview with Major, tune in to the special hour-long edition of E! He was the center of attention all night, and he was loving it!&quot;\nAt 1:28 a.m. the music stopped, Odom&apos;s teammate Ron Artest grabbed the microphone and announced, &quot;Everyone raise their glass ... Sunday is the big day. Big baller&apos;s getting married!&quot;\nClubgoers went crazy, screaming, whistling, and clapping.\n&quot;Lamar was grinning from ear to ear,&quot; says the witness.\nThe DJ followed the toast up with the 50 Cent track, &quot;I Run New York.&quot; (Odom is a native of Queens, N.Y.)\nSays the clubgoer, &quot;The drinking, dancing, and celebrating carried on until close. https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/celebrity-wedding-style-for-less-2009179/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/celebrity-wedding-style-for-less-2009179/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/celebrity-wedding-style-for-less-2009179/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "WeddingChannel.com: How to Say &#8220;I Do&#8221; for Less", "datePublished": "2009-09-17T18:27:05-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:58:23-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "WeddingChannel.com's Charli Penn offers tips and tricks", "articleBody": "By&#xA0;Charli Penn\r\nManaging Editor,&#xA0;WeddingChannel.com\r\n\r\nWho doesn&apos;t want to wed like a celeb? We&apos;re in awe of their gorgeous couture gowns, dazzling over-the-top decor &#xA0;and buzz-worthy A-list guest lists. But let&apos;s be honest: the average bride-to-be is working with a much smaller budget. The good news is that there are lots of easy ways to pull off a celeb wedding for less. Here are a few of our favorite tricks:\r\nPick a Unique Venue\r\nCelebs with million-dollar budgets can afford pricey setups, flowers and decor to create the mood they want, but the average bride has to cut a few corners to pull off seamless decor. Choosing an alternative venue with built-in style (think: a museum, library, or wine bar) will cut costs on decorations while still providing the ambience you&apos;re looking for on your big day. Your wedding site will look fabulous -- simply for the cost you pay to use the space.&#xA0;\r\nGet Personal\r\nStars pull out all the stops to ensure that their weddings not only wow their guests, but also serve as an intimate affair for all. By adding personal touches to a few of your wedding details, you&apos;ll create a one-of-a-kind event your guests will never forget. Personalization doesn&apos;t have to cost a bundle if you&apos;re willing to get creative: Have wedding logos designed and made into stamps that you can use for all of your stationery and favor bags, or consider adding your favorite childhood dishes (his and hers, of course) to the menu. Your guests will love it!\r\nChat with other brides on WeddingChannel.com\r\n\r\nDon&apos;t Scrimp on the Photographer\r\nBefore you cut back on photography for your wedding, stop and ask yourself, What would Fergie do? One thing&apos;s for sure: she wouldn&apos;t get all dressed up for her wedding, complete with flawless hair and makeup, only to risk letting an amateur take her picture. The special moments you share with your guests on your big day will last forever -- caught on camera! -- so remember that you&apos;ll get what you pay for.&#xA0;\r\nDon&apos;t hire a photographer before you read this\r\nGo With a Theme\r\nAshlee Simpson married rocker Pete Wentz in a beautiful outdoor ceremony and reception in her parents&apos; backyard that featured an Alice in Wonderland theme in May 2008. From the 10,000 Black Magic roses on display to the&#xA0;\r\n&quot;Eat Me&quot; and &quot;Drink Me&quot; shooters served at the reception, the pair showed true commitment to their theme and executed it in every detail. It&apos;s a lot easier to pull off a big event when you have a theme to work with -- details come together much more easily, and your guests are guaranteed to still be talking about it on their way home!", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/celebrity-wedding-style-for-less-2009179/#webpage"}, "image": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": He faces off against Hugh Jackman (Australia); Dev Patel (Slumdog Millionaire); Robert Pattinson (Twilight) and Channing Tatum (Fighting).\nSee Brad and Angelina&apos;s Cannes PDA!\nFor &quot;Choice Movie Actress: Drama,&quot; Jolie, who plays the mother of a kidnapped son in Changeling, competes against Nicole Kidman (Australia), Beynonce (Obsessed), Freida Pinto (Slumdog Millionaire) and Kristen Stewart (Twilight).\nSee Angelina Jolie&apos;s baby photo\nBoth Pitt and Jolie are also up against each other in the category of &quot;Choice Celebrity Activist.&quot; (Pitt and his sibs just gave 1 million to help a Missouri hospital open a new pediatric cancer center.) Also competing for the title: Leonardo DiCaprio, Hayden Panettiere and Natalie Portman.  \nSee pics of Hollywood&apos;s most charitable celebs!\nPitt and Jolie weren&apos;t the only stars to get Teen Choice love.  Twilight and its cast lead this year&apos;s nominees with an impressive 12 nominations. High School Musical 3: Senior Year and its cast, Miley Cyrus and Gossip Girl and its cast each scored 10 nominations, while American Idol earned seven nods.  \nStarting today, fans ages 13-19 can vote once each day for their favorite nominee at www.teenchoiceawards.com.  The show airs Monday, Aug. 10, on FOX. Set Source: Heidi Pratt Torture Allegations &#8220;Untrue&#8221;", "datePublished": "2009-06-07T18:28:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T20:59:27-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Though she and Spencer spent 14 hours in the show's \"Lost Chamber,\" rations were provided and they remained unharmed", "articleBody": "In the wake of Internet reports that Heidi and Spencer Pratt were &quot;tortured&quot; on the set of NBC&apos;s I&apos;m a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!, leading to Heidi&apos;s hospitalization Saturday, an on-set source tells Usmagazine.com all allegations are false.\r\n&quot;Any accusations that Spencer and Heidi were harmed are untrue,&quot; the source confirms, adding that while the couple spent approximately 14 hours in the Costa Rican jungle&apos;s &quot;Lost Chamber&quot; awaiting their fate in the series, rations were indeed provided.\r\nAs Us exclusively broke the news of Heidi&apos;s emergency hospitalization in Costa Rica, her sister-in-law, Stephanie Pratt, was among the first to condemn NBC for their alleged actions.  &quot;I&apos;m really saddened to hear that nbc felt it was ok to punish speidi so harshly-and torture them as if they were criminals-that Heidi was...rushed to the hospital and has an IV in her arm after being locked in a dark room for 3 days w no food or water. Pls pray she will be ok,&quot; Stephanie wrote late Saturday.\r\n\r\nAccording to the on-set source, the pair quit the series Monday and stayed in hotels for three days until returning to beg their cast mates to allow them back on the show.   As for the conditions inside the &quot;Lost Chamber&quot;?  &quot;There was no danger, no life-threatening situations -- in fact, they were actually protected from the elements, unlike the other contestants,&quot; the source adds. &quot;When they came out, they were happy and in good spirits.&quot;\r\n\r\nIn a statement to Us, ITV Studios, which produces the series, confirms that a medic and doctor have been present at all times during filming. &quot;ITV has been producing this format around the world for many years and the health of the celebrity participants are of the utmost importance,&quot; the statement read.   A source close to the couple relays their relief after being released from the chamber: &quot;Of course they were in good spirits, they were happy to get out of there. There are always life-threatening situations [in the jungle].  There are snakes out there that can kill you! Kate Slammed for Announcing Split on Show", "datePublished": "2009-06-23T13:51:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T20:59:32-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "They're \"immature and selfish and more concerned about their own needs than what eight little confused children will require emotionally\"", "articleBody": "Friends and family of Jon and Kate Gosselin are slamming the couple for revealing their split on their reality show Monday.\r\n&quot;We&apos;re just so heartbroken and sad about the announcement that they made -- an announcement that could be so life-shattering to a young child,&quot; Kate&apos;s brother, Kevin Kreider, tells RadarOnline.com.&quot;And it was used as a teaser, used to gain ratings, without any regards for my nieces and nephews. It was really hurtful. We were really sad to see that.&quot;\r\n\r\n Adds their onetime neighorbod, Denis: &quot;I do feel bad for the children. Hopefully they will be civil and everything for the kids sake. He needs to get away from her and run as fast as he can. The kids are the ones who will suffer, and that is the sad part.&quot;  \r\n\r\nJon&apos;s former Wyomissing Area Junior/Senior High School classmate Dominick Fabrizio tells Usmagazine.com: &quot;Jon thinks &apos;it is a shame what the world has come to&apos; with the paparazzi surrounding his $1.1-million home that he would not even have without that very public attention. Now that the charade is over, maybe the remaining 30 percent of the viewers still watching will realize no one should be taking life advice from Jon or Kate. I won&apos;t be lining up for an autographed book anytime soon.&quot;\r\n\r\nCritics echo similar sentiments.  Maggie, from the Gosselins Without Pity Web site, tells Us: &quot;I cannot see how announcing your divorce on national television and continuing with the show is in any way putting your children first. I feel sorry for the family, but the parents seem very immature and selfish and far more concerned about their own personal needs than what eight little confused children require emotionally. I can&apos;t believe TLC will keep running the show, but they will!&quot;\r\nAdds the Baltimore Sun&apos;s David Zurawik: &quot;I wonder if [viewers] feel exploited by TLC selling ads and making millions of dollars out of a show announcing a divorce that will not only leave eight kids with a shattered family -- but a video record of their family coming undone that will define them for the rest of their lives. I&apos;m done with this sick carnival side show.&quot;\r\n\r\nThe Los Angeles Times&apos; Jon Caramanica sarcastically wonders if the show will  be renamed Jon Plus 8 when he&apos;s in charge, and Kate Plus 8 when she has custody.  The show will never be the same, he goes on.  &quot;Now that the Gosselins have formally initiated divorce proceedings, never again will the show&apos;s title trigger a sense of optimism and possibility, only a burden that was probably impossible all along,&quot; Caramanica writes.\r\nTell Us: What did you think of Jon and Kate announcing their split on TV?", "isPartOf": {"@id": Chernoff said in a statement. &quot;We reviewed the warrant and remained on the premises while the search was being executed. The search was conducted by members of the DEA, two Robbery - Homicide detectives from the Los Angeles Police Department and Houston Police officers.&quot;\nHe added: &quot;The search warrant authorized law enforcement to search for and seize items, including documents, they believed constituted evidence of the offense of manslaughter. Law enforcement concluded their search around 12:30pm, and left with a forensic image of a business computer hard drive and 21 documents. None of the documents taken had previously been requested by law enforcement or the L.A. Coroner&apos;s office.&quot;\nOn Tuesday, the Los Angeles Times reported that Murray -- who was with Jackson when he suffered cardiac arrest and died June 25 -- remains a central figure in the probe.\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s pill addiction began\nIn fact, officials from the L.A. County coroner&apos;s office also have requested another interview with Murray. (Investigators have asked for medical records in addition to those Murray has already provided.)\nSee 32 photos from inside Michael Jackson&apos;s Staples Center memorial\nMurray&apos;s attorney, however, wants everyone to leave his client alone.  Ed Chernoff tells Usmagazine.com, &quot;The coroner wants to clear up the cause of death, we share that goal.&quot;  &quot;We don&apos;t have access to the most important information in this case... the toxicology report,&quot; he continued. &quot;We&apos;re still in the dark like everybody else. Based on Dr. Murray&apos;s minute-by-minute and item-by-item description of Michael Jackson&apos;s last days, he should not be a target of criminal charges.&quot;\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\n&quot;Murray,&quot; Chernoff added, &quot;was the last doctor standing when Michael Jackson died and it seems all the fury is directed toward him. Dr. Murray is frustrated by negative and often erroneous media reports, he has to walk around 24-7 with a bodyguard. He can&apos;t operate his practice. He can&apos;t go to work because he is harassed no matter where he goes.&quot;  \nRevisit the King of Pop&apos;s most unforgettable moments.\nHe said Murray will continue to cooperate with investigators, as he did with Wednesday&apos;s search. And when I found out that, in fact, it had, it took me about 48 hours to sort of strike the balance in how I was going to approach being &#x2013; you know, being invited to this unbelievable event without actually having the proximity to Michael Jackson, personally. I&apos;d never met him.&quot;\r\nMayer performed an instrumental version of Jackson&apos;s hit &quot;Human Nature&quot; at Tuesday&apos;s memorial. He said he is glad he didn&apos;t end up singing.\r\n\r\n&quot;The decision to not sing is just out of knowing what&apos;s best for me,&quot; he said, adding that he doesn&apos;t have a strong vocal range. &quot;I think it&apos;s quite a mine field to go into trying to in any way replicate vocally what Michael Jackson has done.  And in a way, it was sort of respectfully leaving an absence, you know, sort of the presence of his absence.&quot;\r\nHe added that Usher&apos;s rendition of &quot;Gone Too Soon&quot; was &quot;unbelievable.&quot;\r\n\r\nLooking back on Tuesday&apos;s memorial, Mayer said he is amazed at how &quot;humanizing it was. You know, Michael Jackson wasn&apos;t super human.  He was extra human.&quot;\r\n\r\nAdded Mayer, &quot;I think everybody who watched the service, I think by the end of it &#x2013; the best service of all was the service done to Michael Jackson to sort of render him finally as being a human being.&quot;\r\n&quot;How do I resume Twittering after a day like yesterday?&quot; the singer wrote &#x2013; on Twitter &#x2013; today. &quot;My cells feel different. Kingston&apos;s whole thing is, &apos;I need, I need.&apos; He is insane right now.   &quot;We&apos;re just hoping for the best and that he&apos;s not going to turn out to be a freak, but we&apos;ll see,&quot; she goes on.\nCheck out more pics of rocker chicks.\n Stefani says she &quot;might never be able to write another song. Who knows? I did try. So here we are, going on a tour without a new record.&quot;  She&apos;s not too worked up about it.  &quot;But, then I think, what I&apos;ve gone through is major, right?  I got married and had two human beings come out of my body -- plus two albums and two clothing lines that were born during the same period. I&apos;m still nursing! I&apos;m a little sucked dry.   &quot;Like maybe once I sleep through the night, maybe I&apos;ll be able to write a song. According to the British newspaper The Sun, employees at the store tried to maintain control by letting in shoppers in groups of 150 at a time, allowing them only 20 minutes of browse time.   Kate, 33, wore a red dress to the special four-hour preview session which took place at the flagship store on London&apos;s Oxford Street.   Topshop ordered huge quantities of the clothes, expecting high demand. A spokeswoman for the chain said: &quot;Most of the things have been bought in large volumes.&quot;  Nevertheless, to prevent shoppers from buying the clothes in bulk and then selling them on eBay, customers were allowed to buy just five items each.   The same rules will apply when the clothes are launched in 225 stores nationwide on Tuesday morning.   Students Anna Gordon and Molly Marot, both 13, and Lalaya Lumley, 14, ditched class early for the sale, and showed up with &quot;I Love Kate Moss&quot;&#x9D; scrawled across their foreheads in neon pen.   Moss&apos; mother, Linda, and actress Sadie Frost, were on hand to show their support, as well as socialite Peaches Geldof and supermodel Lily Cole.  Moss, who had a stint in rehab in 2005, sipped champagne with the chain&apos;s billionaire owner, Philip Green. &quot;It&apos;s exciting,&quot; he said. &quot;It wouldn&apos;t be here if we actress, 62, a week ago, and &quot;she was 101 pounds,&quot; which he calls &quot;a reasonable weight&quot; under the circumstances. She&apos;s continuing to eat as much as she can, and we&apos;re continuing to have a good array of nutritious food offerings so she can do that.&quot;  &quot;All cancer treatments tend to erode your appetite a little bit,&quot; he tells Us, adding that, under treatment, bodies don&apos;t always process food as efficiently as they might otherwise.  &quot;That&apos;s why nutrition is a very active part of any treatment,&quot; he said. &quot;We&apos;re paying a lot of attention to that with her, and she&apos;s very aware of that.&quot;\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos\nLuckily, Fawcett has &quot;lived a very healthy lifestyle all of her life, and nutrition has always been important to her, so she&apos;s continuing to work on that.&quot;  Fawcett was released from a Los Angeles hospital on April 9 as she wages a  long battle with anal cancer, first diagnosed in 2006.  &quot;She has gained some of her strength back and she&apos;s able to walk around,&quot; Piro tells Us. On Saturday night. after the singer, 25, was spotted behind the wheel of her white Mercedes with Sean Preston, 2, and Jayden James, 1, in Studio City, California, Spears skipped out on clubbing for some quiet time with her children at her Beverly Hills home.   Kevin Federline&apos;s bodyguard picked the boys up around 9 a.m Sunday.  At 1:45 p.m. Spears and a pal hit a nearby Starbucks, where she was met with a barrage of questions from photographers.  Fresh from getting her lips plumped last week, Spears covered her mouth the entire time as she spoke.  When asked what she thought of the Malibu fires &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x201D; which destroyed at least 39 homes and other buildings in Southern California Sunday&#x201D; she told photographers, &quot;Well, it&apos;s not near my house.&quot;   When asked about her Halloween plans, she replied, &quot;I don&apos;t know yet.&quot;   As for what sons Sean and Preston will dress as, &quot;I don&apos;t know ... maybe pumpkins,&quot; she said.  She also revealed her next single will be called &quot;Someone&quot; and is due out in December.  At around 5 p.m., Spears, dressed in hot pink shorts and a white shirt and toting around an oversized fuchsia purse, hit Epitome tanning salon in Bel-Air.  By 5:25 p.m., sources tells Usmagazine.com Spears stopped off at a Cold Stone Creamery for &quot;cake batter&quot; ice cream.  &quot;Britney kept asking the worker to &quot;hurry up&quot; and said that Cake Batter was her favorite,&quot; a source tells Us. Kate said the fact that her future family vacations would be without Jon &quot;was never lost on me the entire time. It was weird to pack alone, to board the bus. It was minus Jon anyway you look at it. Many times everyday it occurred to me this will probably be how it will be.&quot;  During the second week of their trip, Kate made the kids bacon and sausage, took them to the beach and to the serpentarium. (The kids also acted out little plays which Kate said they picked up from her. As a kid, Kate used to put on shows forher grandparents. &quot;I  have very vivid memories of - are you surprised -  drama!&quot; she said.)\r\nLook back at photos of Jon and Kate Gosselin through the years Jon&apos;s absence was palpable.  &quot;Daddy&apos;s at the house,&quot; one of the kids noted; added another, &quot;I miss daddy.&quot;  See how Jon and Kate spent their hiatus\r\nKate said &quot;I can do the best I can do for my kids... but I can never make up for him.  I can&apos;t make up for the fact that he&apos;s not here. It&apos;s difficult.&quot;  While the kids were vacationing, Jon was overseeing the kitchen renovations. He said it was odd not having the little ones around. (But he said he was glad Kate wasn&apos;t there because she would have been &quot;yelling that there&apos;s a mess,&quot; which he said would have been &quot;constantly annoying.&quot;)  &quot;It&apos;s hard to talk about,&quot; Jon said of the end of his marriage. &quot;It&apos;s a fact of life; this is the way it&apos;s going to be. I don&apos;t think I&apos;ll ever get used to it... but it&apos;s becoming more comfortable now.&quot;  Twins Mady and Cara left the trip early, as they had to finish school. They were thrilled to see their dad, but were put off by his earrings.  &quot;What&apos;s in your ears?&quot; one of them asked. Jon - whose Ed Hardy T-shirt was blurred out - said he&apos;d had his ears pierced since he was 15 and denied he was going through a mid-life crisis.  He said it&apos;s &quot;always the way I express myself. Things are coming out a lot more now. This is who I am.&quot;\r\nKate who? Meet Jon Gosselin&apos;s new women\r\nAt the end of the show, Kate returned home to see the kitchen renovations Jon had been overseeing.  &quot;I was grouchy that morning when we arrived home,&quot; she said, adding that &quot;it probably didn&apos;t seem like I was grateful.&quot; She added that the kitchen &quot;was beautiful. I would not go in for Botox or anything like that. I&apos;m content with the way I look. What&apos;s wrong with looking like Susan Boyle? What&apos;s the matter with that?&quot;   \nCheck out Us&apos; biggest celeb makeover photo gallery\nShe said she&apos;s been &quot;very taken aback especially by all the American people who have been kind enough to say nice things about me. I didn&apos;t expect that. People have been very kind.&quot; (She had &quot;no comment&quot; when asked if a record deal was in the works.)   \nSee the weight ups and downs of former Idol contestants\nAs for her sudden fame -- more than 20 million people have watched her &quot;I Dreamed a Dream&quot; performance -- Boyle, 48, admitted, &quot;I&apos;ve got a lot to learn about a lot of things. This is all very new to me. I went to bed one night, just me, and woke up in the morning to a group of about 30 children outside chanting my name. Then I came home from my brother&apos;s, and it was like the paparazzi were all in the street.&quot;\n See which former Idol stars have gotten married or have had children\nAlthough she is favored to win Britain&apos;s Got Talent, Boyle said, &quot;I&apos;m taking baby steps at the moment. I&apos;m just an ordinary person trying to make it as a professional singer. I really don&apos;t want to change all that much.&quot;  As for her claims that she&apos;s never been kissed?  &quot;Oh, I was just joking around,&quot; she said. &quot;It was just banter and it has been blown way out of proportion. I was about to go on stage and I was very nervous.&quot;  &quot;All I want to say is that I am single at the moment, but I keep waiting,&quot; she said. &quot;I am not on the hunt. I am happy as I am.&quot;  With a laugh, she added, &quot;It&apos;s all very embarrassing. What else can I say? We just got torn apart.&quot;  \nCheck out more controversial reality show stars\nThe courtroom scene Tuesday was a stark contrast to the months of bitter feuding.\nThe two -- who have two kids, Brooke and Nick -- had clashed over everything from money to Linda allowing her younger boyfriend to drive the couple&apos;s vehicles. Murray also later accompanied the ambulance to the UCLA Medical Center, where Jackson was pronounced dead at 2:26 p.m. PST.\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nInvestigative reporter Diane Dimond -- who has covered Michael Jackson for years -- said on CBS&apos; The Early Show Saturday Edition: &quot;If he was the only doctor on the scene and, as we heard in the 911 call, worked on Michael Jackson for quite awhile before they called 911, he may be culpable of something. I hope he&apos;s got a good lawyer.&quot;\nPolice stress that Murray is not considered to be a suspect; they just want to question him.  Although toxicology test results won&apos;t be available for up to six weeks (a preliminary autopsy showed no foul play),\nJackson family attorney Brian Oxman told Usmagazine.com he fears prescription drugs played a role. &quot;I only know that I warned them there was the misuse of prescription medications by people who were enabling him; his handlers, folks who should never have been permitted to allow him to use those medications in the manner I observed,&quot; he told Us.  \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\nA spokesman for the Los Angeles County Coroner&apos;s Office has said they know that Jackson had been taking prescription drugs but needed to find out the specific medications.   Murray -- who reportedly is licensed in California, Nevada and Texas and has an office in Houston -- had treated Jackson for three years.\nTwo weeks ago -- around the time Murray reportedly announced he was shutting down his private practice -- Jackson requested that Murray be with him, according to reports. He was then hired by AEG Live, which was producing Jackson&apos;s upcoming London shows.\nDimond, the reporter who covered Jackson, said she was &quot;stunned to learn this doctor [Murray] was hired by the concert promoter (AEG Live), I guess at Michael&apos;s request. He wanted to have a doctor with him. I worked in Hollywood for many years, (for) most of the &apos;90s, and when the celebrities have a personal doctor, it&apos;s really a prescription writer; it&apos;s really a personal drug supplier.&quot;\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nBut she said she&apos;s &quot;covered Michael Jackson since 1993. He has always had an entourage of people around him of people who do exactly what he says, or they&apos;re not there anymore. As to who is responsible, I believe in personal responsibility: You put a pill in your mouth, you did that, you put a needle in your arm, you did that. But ... there were enablers around him.&quot;\nShe believes drugs led to his death.  &quot;I&apos;m not the only one who says he&apos;s a drug addict. ... But I think so,&quot; she said. &quot;The coroner said (they saw) no visible signs of trauma, so that tells me his anorexia (Jackson reportedly weighed 125 lbs. at the time of his death) did not cause a diseased heart. They didn&apos;t say they saw a diseased heart or a bad ventricle or artery. So, it&apos;s something else that killed him.&quot;\nEven Jackson pal Liza Minnelli has her suspicions:  &quot;When the toxicology test comes out,&quot; she said on The Early Show earlier this week,  &quot;you-know-what&apos;s gonna break loose.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/scrutiny-on-michael-jacksons-doctor-intensifies-2009276/#webpage"}, "image": Travolta said, according to the Associated Press.\n\nHe said that when he got to him, one of the Jett&apos;s caretakers was already performing chest compressions.\nThe actor then quickly began administering CPR to his son, who later died from a seizure.\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news pics\nAfter Travolta&apos;s brief testimony, the court took their lunch break.\nTravolta and Preston were quickly escorted out of the courtroom.\nHe is expected to return to the stand this afternoon\nTravolta is the star witness at the trial of two people &#x2014; paramedic Tarino Lightbourne and former Bahamas senator Pleasant Bridgewater &#x2014; who are accused of trying to extort $25 million from the movie star. he tells RapRadar.com.\r\n&quot;I&apos;m a big fan of his work so I agreed to get involved with the gag.&quot;\r\nSee what the stars wore to the 2009 MTV Movie Awards.\r\nDuring Sunday night&apos;s show, the rapper ended up with Cohen -- dressed up as his flamboyant character, Bruno -- landing face-down in his lap. After the showdown, viewers questioned whether it was staged. (A show writer admitted it was on Tuesday.)  &quot;I&apos;m thrilled we pulled this off better than we rehearsed it,&quot; Eminem says. &quot;It had so many people going &apos;nuts&apos; so to speak. Everyone was blowing me up about it.\r\nCheck out more photos of stars goofing off.\r\n&quot;After the ceremony I went back to my hotel and laughed uncontrollably for about three hours,&quot; he goes
